3.description: Never really had a bad experience, if i call in my order is either ready or its almost ready. Good food and i really dont have nothing bad to say. When i wanna get away from jerk chicken i hit this spot.

1.description: I swear I only come here cause the BF likes their food. Don't get me wrong. It's good. But the customer service sucks. Every cashier I ever experienced here has the swankiest attitude and acts like my ordering food here somehow inconvenience them. Not to mention the local weed man and bootleg movies stay posted at all times. That might be a good thing if that's what you're into.

2.description: A buddy and I would've given I57 a higher ranking, but the young lady who took our order had a very funky attitude - for no apparent reason.  I told her that this was our first time eating at I57!  Sauce is Boss.  All I wanted was a sample of their three different barbecue sauces, but she told us "we don have anythin to give out fo you to sample are sauces in." Pssssss...she should not be your front line if she can't service customers with a smile.  Good food plus bad customer service do not necessarily bring customers back.  Attention Owner/Manager.......please fix this problem because your reputation and brand should be and is important.  There are hundreds of rib joints shacks throughout the greater Chicagoland.  Your customers deserve better service when they are spending their hard earned money.  I ordered the lunch portion mini rib tips for about 6 or 7 dollars and it came with 5 rib tips, 15 french fries, 2 slices of cheap white bread, cole slaw and a diabetic red "Vess" pop.  I will admit that the meat was actually cooked well and it was tender too....so they know how to Q.  I just wished that I had a chance to try their other types of barbecue sauces.I will give I57 another chance, but it will not be at the one on Western.

5.description: Soul food? Yes, please! A bunch of us at the office decided to order carry-out one day and we opted for I-57 Rib House. Barbecue rib tips, sausage links, chicken wings, fried gizzards, fried catfish.....the list goes on. You know the deal.I had the lunch special with fried catfish nuggets, French fries, bread, hushpuppies, and pop. All for just $6! The food arrived lukewarm so I had to toss it in the microwave for a minute. Surprisingly, the four chunks of catfish remained intact and crispy! Couldn't complain much! The bed of fries, on the other hand, under performed. It was soft and bland. Fortunately, my order also came with salt. But where was the pepper?! The bread was simply two slices of whites placed on top like a hat. Nothing to bring home about.Note: Their hot sauce isn't weak. Beware!

6.description: This place is not as clean as the one on 115th! Food is not that fresh. Customer service is skills are lacking. They are very rude and obnoxious! They handle call ins very unprofessional!! I had guests here from out of state who placed an order over the phone and the girl who took the call was very rude and disrespectful. My thing is If you don't like your job then find a new one.  Western will not be getting any money from me any more!

7.description: I love this spot. A few of the locations have closed down and I am glad that this one survived.  Call your order in to cut down on the wait time. All fried orders do take awhile as the cook them to order, but worth the wait. I took tip / chicken combo in to work and it was funny to see the people come around the corner asking what I had that smelled so good, and yes I shared :). It's a CASH only place.

0.description: Yeah I tried Alices, but not as good as I57. Food has always been the best around, yes they are slow, but worth the wait.One bad experience doesn't count for everything. If you haven't tried this place yet, I suggest you go for it! The one on 97th and Halsted may be even better

4.description: I love i57 ribhouse. I normally get the wing and tip combo with hot sauce. Its one of the best rib tip restaurants in the city.

1.description: Great service in English and Spanish!! Have had the banana split ice-cream and different aguas-frescas (they will mix 2 different flavored aguas ... the Chia Lemonade blended with Cucumber Water is divine). And the prices are hard to beat

2.description: Love it! Huge ice cream selection! Exceptional customer service!!!! My kids and I love going to mangos for our weekly treat!

0.description: I love coming here with my family for some quick food. They have a big variety of things to pick from. The service is great and of course the food is delicious  The atole and tamales are definitely the best.

3.description: This ALDI is so great. DEFINITELY worth the price, and even cleanliness and easiness of shopping, advantage over Treasure Island if you're just looking for basic grocery store goods. I got 6 packs of bacon (6 lbs, 120 strips), 4 packs of waffles (40 waffles), and syrup for $25. Damn. By far best prices I know of in the area (which is, admittedly, hard-pressed for grocery stores).In the day time, I felt completely safe in the area. Minus one star for the fact that it's sort of inconsistent for some goods, because, you know, it's ALDI, it's not great at much more than the basic food stuff. I felt like I maybe could have found better prices for apricots and definitely better prices for chocolate bar at Trader Joe's (PERHAPS Hyde Park Produce), but after the time and cost of transit... generally a good bet. Just be prepared to go to a different store if you have really specific needs.Speaking to the safety of the area... it's seriously so fine. People from Hyde Park who feel in danger here I think are mostly awkward nerds who don't know how to interact in grocery stores without pissing people off. I try to go before sunset, but taking the bus I may go later.

1.description: Surprisingly, this store was well maintained, stocked full of variety, and clean. The cashier was pleasant and courteous to my wife and I. Counter space was plentiful to bag your groceries and people shopping weren't loud and ghetto. Definitely A+ in my book. I recommend Aldi on 67th and Cottage....I didn't give it five stars because, well, it's an Aldi!

2.description: I like this Aldi a lot!It's new, it's clean and open, it has friendly staff, and it has cheap groceries.This is not the closest Aldi to me, but it's one of my favorite Aldi's.Their produce (fresh and frozen), milk, canned foods, and frozen pizza are a great deal.

0.description: I'm a Hyde Parker and this is one of my regular grocery stores, along with the Marianos on Clark and 18th street and Hyde Park Produce.  I pick up my staples here (milk, flour, dark chocolate (!), etc. )  As others have said, it is super cheap and clean.  Lines can be a bit long if you come at a popular time, but move quickly   I'm often the only white person there, which is surprising given the large student population close by.

Have you ever been driving home late and night and found yourself wishing that there was a friendly Mexican woman waiting at your house to prepare a delicious snack to satiate your late-night cravings? No?  Well then maybe it's just me.  But I was fortunate enough to date a guy who lived close to La Sirena II, and we would stop by this restaurant in the wee hours of the morning to fill our tummies with delicious authentic Mexican food.  Upon entering the front door you are greeted warmly by a little Mexican man or woman and offered a seat at the spotless counter or at a table facing the TV. The TV is always playing telenovelas.  The menu selection isn't vast, but the food is fresh and made-to-order.  Tacos are something like $2 apiece, and two or three are always enough.  My favorites are tacos al pastor and tacos con carne asada.  They're not bogged down with dairy products as many other places might serve them: they consist simply of meat, tortilla, cilantro, and onions. You can also add tomato and lettuce if you wish, and a couple times I was treated to freshly sliced avocado free of charge.  If you go earlier in the day they serve a full dinner menu (not just tacos).  One time I showed up while on phase 1 of the South Beach Diet and the cook was kind enough to prepare a meal with no rice, beans, or tortilla. It wound up just being  meat with an assortment of peppers and onions, but it was delicious. It momentarily made me forget how obnoxious I was being for imposing my stupid white middle class fad diet on a hole-in-the-wall-type Mexican joint.There is a bar in a separate space at the rear of the building.  I've never hung out there but it seems to be popular. It's always crowded; there is a pool table and a jukebox blaring Spanish music. You can even order a Corona at the restaurant counter and someone will bring it to you from the bar. If you don't speak Spanish you may have some difficulty communicating with the staff, but as long as you know how to say "por favor" and "gracias" as well as the names of the food you're ordering, you'll be just fine.

1.description: The place is small and the people rush to get things done ! The guy who did my manicure did an awesome job but the lady who did my pedicure messed up the design by putting the top coat on before the design dried and it smeared the lade who did my eye brow waxing made them uneven and two totally different shapes! The price was ok but not worth this nonsense!

0.description: Once you get past the overwhelming smell of dibutyl phthalate, toluene and formaldehyde, (that will truly give a sensitive person an instant headache) you realize this salon is one of Chicago Lawn's best kept secrets when all is said and done. Sure the place could use a face lift but I'm not looking for ambiance! Give me clean tools, genuine friendliness, great nails and a good price and I'm happy.I came in with very high expectations being that the two previous salons were huge disappointments. I told David (the nail technician) that I wanted fills though I needed serious repair due to the bad jobs done elsewhere. He took his time and did such a great job that I'll be turning all my friends on to this place. I'll definitely return faithfully!

58.description: this is not a place for the weak stomach. you might want to do some calisthenics before you go. it is delicious though. who ever thought a hot dog, wrapped in a tamale topped with cheese sauce, chili, a cucumber and celery salt would be good? but it is. and i would highly recommend going all out for the mighty dog if you go. the place is pretty shabby and not necessarily clean looking but very tasty.must try: mighty dog

56.description: Great, great little shack in Englewood. It's not in the greatest neighborhood but don't be scared though, nothing's gonna happen. It's on a main street anyways.Been here a couple times now and the mother in law and the mighty dog are certainly the way to go. And you must have a suicide which is hit or miss depending on how the guy goes with it when filling it up. Literally this place is like a shack and there's a picnic table about 50 feet away I always end up sitting there and eating. Who knows if it's even a part of Johnnie's but who cares really when you're so gratified with the food you're ingesting.

29.description: Sure the neighborhood is sketchy,  and the stand looks run down, but the dogs are good.  The condiments they use are fresh. Prices are reasonable.  This place is at the very least worth one trip.

42.description: Drove past and my food senses went crazy. Out of the corner of my eye I saw a dilapidated old shack with a line in front and a big weiner on the sign.  It was time for my first Chicago Dog. Being from New York I knew I couldn't order the staple mustard and kraut. I told the fine gentlemen behind the counter that I had faith in their best judgment. If you are ever in Chicago and driving past this place do yourself a favor and pull over. Great dog guys.

23.description: My first Fat Johnnies experience today was excellent.  My fiancé has been frequenting this place for years and years and couldn't wait to introduce me to it.  The location is a little sketch but don't let that turn you off.  I tried the "Mighty Dog" it's was about 5lbs of goodness.  A born and raised Chicagoan turned Phoenician can appreciate a great Chicago dog.  If you are in this area it's a MUST!!

47.description: 2.5* Red Hot with everything3* Dog with Chili & Cheese3.5* Sundae Tamale

8.description: Stop reading this, stop talking about it.  Just go.  Chicago staple.  Friendly service.  Unbeatable prices.Why are you still reading this?  GO!  (oh, and plan to eat there - outside, the dogs don't travel well)  (oh, and finish it off with Rainbow Cone for a true Chicago experience)

31.description: Let me start by saying PLEASE pay no mind to those from Naperville and Wilmette etc that warn against the roving gang bangers and snipers on the roof waiting to pick off suburban white people as they indulge on a hot dog!!  Yes it's the city but no accountants from Lemont have been savagely attacked...so relax. With that said...this place is the best. Fantastic hot dogs with no frills.  Places like this make Chicago the great city it is!  If you are more into Jamba Juice and Chipotle...isn't for you. For hot dog lovers...it's the spot!!!  Enjoy.

34.description: OVERRATED.  Pretty hard to mess up a hot dog.  No need to make a trip if not close to you.  Plus the neighborhood is sketchy.

16.description: It is almost impossible to choose BESTs when it comes to Chicago foods. You would have to sub categorize everything to even get close. The most one could do is to say YOU MUST TRY FAT JOHNNIES HOT DOGS AND OR POLISH SAUSAGES. In addition, you must return and order each style they offer (weekly).

13.description: Probably the biggest surprise I've had in the hot dog world. The shack-like exterior hides a bounty of deliciousness inside. I had the Super Fat One which is a 1/4# dog with chili, cheese and tomatoes. I've had hundreds of hot dogs all over the country and this place is in the top 3.

11.description: Little dump hot dog stand in a dangerous hood.  So don't drive from Wilmette or Tinley Park for your city hot dog experience.  That being said, if you're driving by at noon,  the dogs here are great.Five stars for the food, one star for the gang bangers and bad guys that make us have to avoid this neighborhood.

39.description: Just a quick update - I had not been back to Fat Johhnies since my last review because I live so far away from it. I went there Yesterday and it was just as good as I remember it.

37.description: Little dump hot dog stand in a dangerous hood.  So don't drive from Wilmette or Tinley Park for your city hot dog experience.  That being said, if you're driving by at noon,  the dogs here are great.Five stars for the food, one star for the gang bangers and bad guys that make us have to avoid this neighborhood.

0.description: Fat Johnnie's attains low-end, eat-on-the-sidewalk perfection. I enjoyed an excellent Chicago dog, the ingredients threatening to topple over but remaining in place. I also liked the "mother-in-law," which features a tamale in a hot dog roll. It's inexplicable but intriguing if you're not afraid of carbs. I got the "suicide" soda, just a mix of everything. No need for you to try that. The menu isn't super-long. They have Polish sausages. They probably don't have salads.

38.description: Fat Johnnie's has some of the best hot dogs in the city. It's been in business for over 40 years for a reason. I ordered a super fat one, a red hot, and a super dog. The hotdog, bread, cucumber, and chili were delicious. I think the cheese is cheesewhiz but who cares. Most people probably won't go far South but I had no problem going there. There are three green benches right next to Fat Johnnie's to sit down. Also, Fat Johnnie's only has chips or Doritos as sides. There are no French fries. Yes, it is a hole in the wall type of place and it's probably best not to look inside the window. You were warned. LOL.

51.description: Now this is a REAL hot dog place. I have tried the nachos, which are oh so delish. They serve REAL vienna beef products and the tamales are the BOMB. I have never been upset or dissatisfied with my food with Fat Johnnie's. I guess with a name like Fat Johnnie, you can't make a mistake with food.

27.description: There is NO PLACE LIKE IT.  Fat Johnnie's -- it's what life is all about!  AND they CATER!  YUP!  Hosted them at my grammar school reunion.  They run about $7.25/person, minimum 40 people, for two hours. People LOVED it. They brought their cart to Cork & Kerry and served up what they do best -- hot dogs!  Fat Johnnie's is a South Side tradition.  Just like Rainbow Cone!   I don't have a "favorite," it all depends on what I'm in the mood for... Even a plain hot dog from Fat Johnnie's is heavenly. But know this, this is not a restaurant. It is a trailer.  It is not a good neighborhood. So you have to stand outside and eat or in your car or take home.  I wish they would just move further south. Alsip, on Pulaski, 115th - 127th, has some property.  They'd fare very well down here.

32.description: Don't let the neighborhood or the looks of this place intimidate you! this joint serves in my opinion one of the best Chicago style hot dog you'll ever eat! This is not your typical hot dog stand, everything is steamed and you won't find anything fried, the place looks like a whole in the wall but hey sometimes these kind of places serve the best food! One more thing do not ask for ketchup if you don't want yo get slap in the face :) ohh and it's probably best if you don't look inside when ordering :) Don't say I didn't Warned you.

48.description: You don't go to Fat Johnnie's for the ambiance, you go for a hot dog.  I have been frequenting Fat Johnnies since I was a kid (Could be 40 years, Johnnies would have to check the math), and I still stop every time I am in the area.  Hands down best dog on the south side.

44.description: This place is literally a shack in a backyard.  They do have a big sign so you won't miss it.  I don't know what I was expecting, I mean they serve hot dogs and I don't really care for hot dogs.  I used to like the Hebrew National dogs from Costco but can only eat half of one maybe once a year.  I think I was expecting to be blown away and feeling like "Oh, I love hot dogs but only from Fat Jonhhine's" but that didn't happen.  We went in the afternoon and had no problems (for those weary of the neighborhood).

7.description: I have been coming here for years. My mom worked at Kraft foods on Rockwell before they closed down and she introduced me to Fat Johnnies one day while I was taking her to work. I was skeptical but since she ranted and raved I decided to try it out. I have been a customer ever since. I love that the products are beef and they are so tasty! My favorite is the Super Sundae which is a tamale topped with chili, tomatoes ,jalapeños ,onions and melted cheese. I hold the onions though. Service is quick and courteous and prices are very reasonable.

49.description: Fat Johnnie's! This is a real south side institution found on the long strip of road that is Western Ave. Bf and I walked on up and got 2 Mighty Dogs (tamale and hot dog) and 2 drinks (one of which was a suicide, a mix of all of their fountain drinks). Its the perfect food for a quick bite, something comfy or something greasy after a few cold ones.

40.description: I'm not a fan since I hate hot dogs but my husband swears by this place.The problem is the neighborhood. It's all fun, games, and good eats until someone gets shot: suntimes.com/15117165-76…69th and Western is way too close to Fat Johnnie's. Sorry husband of mine, you're not bringing our 3 year old there.

53.description: After reading somebody else's review about the sketchy area. I brought a friend during daylight. The drive from the highway isn't so bad; just don't give anybody eye problems and you'll be fine. Upon reaching destination, it looks like a run down shack. So many years of support and local unions and they're still running. Alot of their ingredients you can pick up from your local grocer or bulk sales. It is creatively placed together. For example, the mighty dog; hotdog, tamale, chili & cheese, fresh tomato and cucumbers on a poppy seed hot dog bun. That alone is a meal in itself my friends.I ordered an additional chili dog. Wow, it's real chili.. Not the thin watered down type, but chunky. I'm willing to come back to try the other selections and nachos.I forgot to mention.. it's cheap! and no... it does not come with fries.

30.description: Anyone who calls Fat Johnnie's overrated should be burned at the stake. That being said, holy crap this place is amazing!! Simple and delicious just like a hotdog should be... The Good- Johnnie serves up every single order fresh, so cool to see a local legend still around after 42 years in business!! My kids devoured a cheese dog each in two minutes flat. Insane. The tamales are actually really good which was surprising. The chili and cheese was beyond words. Johnnie slices up  tomatoes and cucumber fresh to order then lays on the celery salt. This is a quaint little building and may have you questioning it at first glance, then you see the table where he sat with Anthony Bordain and his various awards... Really cheap!! The Bad- Crybabies saying that it's overrated or a sketchy neighborhood may keep you away from here which would be a shame!! The Ugly- Parking is terrible in the city, you already know that. Come say hi to Johnnie, he's a great guy and his food is amazing. Cash only!!THE BEST HOTDOG IN THE COUNTRY!!!!!!! voices.suntimes.com/arts…

46.description: one word...iconic. even tho i no longer live in the area, whenever i visit family or friends in the city i will make a stop,cant beat the price . less than $5 for a cheese fat one bag of chips and a drink

1.description: I'll be honest probably the best hot dog in the city. Forget the North Side they have got nothing on the South Side. Grant it it is not in the best neighborhood but it's not that bad they don't keep late hours so you will be fine. My favorite is a hot dog with everything and peppers. If you are making this a destination get a dog with everything, a father-in law , a nacho, and a suicide for your drink. Some more pretentious people may say the place looks like it should be condemned, well damm them and give it a try. Your taste buds will thank you...

55.description: This place has so much character, the kind of character that comes from people that haven't matured much since selling lemonade as a kid. Picture #2 pretty much says it all, a complete menu list handwritten on a single poster board sheet. I'm going to go out on a limb and say that this was an in-house project. The layout, the spacing and most notably, the incredible discipline in not using larger than a size 40 font is certainly masterful. Conveniently, they have reserved the right border column for updating their prices. Save that poster board fellas for as long as you can! As the menu items fade with it's background getting dirtier, the updated price list section gets comparatively brighter. Ironic, such a complete shit hole, yet is able to deliver. I don't want to think about the cleanliness and what might be crawling around in this trailer trash hurricane ready shack. I just can't do it, I just can't, ordering anything from this place that has chili or cheese on it is simply insect roulette. They practically put chili or cheese on about 95% of their creations, so I'll be missing out. The fact that I can get up the nerve to order anything from this place is a miracle in itself. You'll have to experience it yourself, it goes beyond possessing your typical Chicago hot dog stand cheesiness. I can deal with a place that is run down with some effort in making it presentable. Hell, this place is so distressed that it makes Sanford & Son's store front look good. youtube.com/watch?v=1Wqa… In the summer, the adjacent lot has front yard picnic benches which are cordoned off by a rickety old white picket fence. Don't mind the fact that you are dining in front of someones residence. If that isn't special enough, an old dingy in the parkway has been converted into a planter box. Who cares if only weeds grow in the seemingly out of place vessel. Johnnies is about the same distance on the south side from downtown as Fluky's was on the north side, kinda like hot dog stand bookmarks on the longest street in the world. This place looks like it needs to be torn down while the Fluky's that was taken over by U(n) Lucky Dawg remains closed. Now Johnnies won't be serving up a Vienna dog and a David Berg will have to do. That's all right, at least Vienna owns the company.

9.description: Anyone who calls Fat Johnnie's overrated should be burned at the stake. That being said, holy crap this place is amazing!! Simple and delicious just like a hotdog should be... The Good- Johnnie serves up every single order fresh, so cool to see a local legend still around after 42 years in business!! My kids devoured a cheese dog each in two minutes flat. Insane. The tamales are actually really good which was surprising. The chili and cheese was beyond words. Johnnie slices up  tomatoes and cucumber fresh to order then lays on the celery salt. This is a quaint little building and may have you questioning it at first glance, then you see the table where he sat with Anthony Bordain and his various awards... Really cheap!! The Bad- Crybabies saying that it's overrated or a sketchy neighborhood may keep you away from here which would be a shame!! The Ugly- Parking is terrible in the city, you already know that. Come say hi to Johnnie, he's a great guy and his food is amazing. Cash only!!THE BEST HOTDOG IN THE COUNTRY!!!!!!! voices.suntimes.com/arts…

26.description: Oh Boy, you're for a treat when it comes to the amazing Fat Johnnie's.Often times mistaken as a dump or an abandon RV.  If you judged a book by it's cover, you would be so sadly mistaken on this account.This place is the Gem of the Southside Chicago.  It looks like you got the wrong place, but trust me you didn't.I like Fat Johnnie's for their Chili Cheese Dogs... these are the best I've ever had.  And, I try a lot.I think Fat Johnnie claims to have been the inventor of the Chili Cheese dog, and so do about 10 other places.  But, that doesn't matter they do them right.Now the neighborhood is bad, I used to live in Marquette Park area, and would come out here whenever I could.  But, even though it's bad don't let that change your opinion about this place.  Just go when it's light outside and you will not have anything to worry about.  Except the occasional homeless person asking for money.  Don't show fear and you have nothing to worry about.I was talking to a friend once about this place and they said... "Oh yeah, Fat Johnnie's, I was mugged there before... Can't wait to go back."  That makes me giggle whenever I think about it.You can not find another dog anywhere with as much character and flavor as this place. Go, you won't be disappointed.  Even if you get mugged.

25.description: I'll never eat a hot dog anywhere else. Fat Johnnie's is a south side necessity!

12.description: Who says simple can't be perfection? This spot makes the best hotdogs in Chicago. Period. It's located in a sh*thole so nasty you'll question your wits for going there to get said hotdogs, but if you get deep into the selections on subsequent visits you'll discover the secret...everything is good. The Mighty Dog is a true game changer and the Super Polish is sublime. I recommend those two legends out of the gate.

59.description: Fat Johnnie's is the best hot dog in the city.  I grew up eating these things on the South Side.

21.description: Just wow is all I can say. I got a cheese double dog, and it was THAT good! Definitely somewhere to go again.

17.description: Let me be upfront and say, "Yes, It is a  dive, Hot Dog Shack." But don't let the looks fool you! And if you haven't seen it yet, this place was voted by TWO  Major Magazines as the best Hot Dog in the USA ! Ranked number one over some major Hot Dog Joints.Bottom Line: Get the "Mighty Dog" or "Mighty Polish." It is insane! Hot Dog with Cheese Sauce, Chili Sauce, Cucumber Slice, Tom Tom Tamale, Tomatoes, Onions, Sport Peppers............God , I'm getting hungry just by writing this.And, Every time I go there without fail, they are so very courteous. They keep calling me "Sir" and I keep looking around see who they're talking too. LOLBest "Dog" in the good ol' U.S. of A. and Polite to boot! Go get yourself some!

10.description: I can see salvation from the #49 Western Ave bus. The glowing lights, and the arrow pointing to on of the BEST hot dogs in America (as just voted on by Food and Drink). It's not fine dining, or table cloth service. As a matter of fact, it's nothing more than a shack with a couple benches in front. What the place lacks in aesthetics, it makes up for in The Dog.

5.description: The are DELICIOUS!!!! Little hole in the wall spot it looks crappy but ohhhhh my word you will leave satisfied. The customer service is outstanding. Loved loved loved my food.

3.description: Excellent!  Probably the best hot dog I have ever had, large size and generous chili, I think it was called the super dog,   For $2.75 I had what I needed, until I got a block down the street and wanted to turn around and get another!Looked like a cross between and ice fishing hut and a speak easy from the roaring 20's but what the heck, who needs to know what is going on behind the plywood front, just like who needs to know what goes into a hot dog!  Best dog I have had in Chicago that is for sure, and the added excitement of the neighborhood makes it seem so "bad"!

35.description: As a true Southsider,  and fan of Fat Johnnie's for as long as they've been around, man up if you truly want to experience THE BEST HOT DOG IN CHICAGO!!! For those who can't handle the experience, why not have them come to you. I recently had Fat Johnnie's cater our daughters party,  and they did not disappoint. Those who are familiar along with those new to the scene were satisfied with what was offered! They brought all that is avaiable at the fine Southside establishment and nobody left hungry. Kudos to Johnnie and the boys for making the day memorable. I know you'll be catering more parties of ours, as well as our friends.

19.description: Best Hot Dogs in Chicago. Don't expect to be impressed by the ambience. This is a small trailer set among shady used car dealers. They still manage to make the best dogs around. They use David Berg Frankfurters, which have more flavor(garlic) than most. I would recommend the 'Fat One', a quarter pound of beef on a perfect bun with mustard. There are, of course, other toppings available but I'm a purist.

28.description: I grew up in the Marquette Park neighborhood and grew up eating Fat Johnnies. Whenever people ask me, what are the best Hot Dogs in Chicago, I always say FAT JOHNNIE'S! They are without a doubt the best tasting hot dogs I have ever had in my 36 years in life.

45.description: Yep, this place is great!!! I grew up a 1/2 block away from here, quite a bit of my allowance money was spent here as a kid. Hotdogs are amazing and the nachos are pretty good too! Maybe my addiction to hotdogs started because my mother frequented this place when pregnant with me? Fat Johnnie is a pretty nice guy too, usually was always working back in the day. Haven't been there in years, yes the neighborhood is sketchy now but don't let that stop you, Western Avenue is super busy and there are usually lines there too.

33.description: Simply the best hot dog you'll ever have. They steam everything, so don't expect any fried stuff.

43.description: A pretty good South Side institution.  I'm a big fan of the tamale sundae but not so much of the mother-in-law because the tamale just wasn't the same in the bun. (did that last bit sound dirty?  I agree.)Their hot dogs have that satisfying snap that is part of the eating experience.There ain't any fries but that ain't no thing because they have grape pop readily available, as well as an outdoor (s)eating area complete with canoes that double as flower pots.Helpful tip: Parking can be tricky if it's busy because of the limited spots along Western Avenue but you can always temporarily park on the median and put your blinkers on (which is the universal symbol for "It's okay.  I'm allowed to park here for however long I want.")

2.description: Woke up on a Saturday morning and have been "taking care of myself" for a whole week now since wife is out of town. Was supposed to recaulk the bathtub, but couldn't find the caulk gun or the caulk. So instead I go looking up best hot dogs in Chicago. Was a little saddened that nothing popped up in the SW 'burbs where I now reside, but another site gave me Fat Johnnie's and FJ's was where I went!Had the mother-in-law, mighty dog, and a fat one. Why? Because I could and it was delicious. Ate in the car as I didn't want my food to get cold on the way home and besides being a bit messy everything was good. I wouldn't call it the best, but I did like the tamale with the dog. Only con was didn't get to see this infamous Johnnie. Neighborhood seemed fine with the Popeye's next door. I'm not going to call myself a Southsider yet and I have aspirations to take my kids someday to places like Superdawgs, Byron's, and Wolfy's on the Northside, but definitely I'll let them eat here... as long as they don't ask for ketchup or cheer for the Sox...

18.description: Just wow is all I can say. I got a cheese double dog, and it was THAT good! Definitely somewhere to go again.

41.description: this place rocks!!!  food is fanastc

52.description: Fat Johnnies serves up grade A dogs. I grew up on 77th and Whipple over in Ashburn and Fat Johnnies was the absolute go to for my family for hot dogs. Yes, it's located in a pretty shitty neighborhood and yes, the place looks like a dump, but it can deliver some of the best dogs in the Southside for next to nothing.  The mother-in-law is legendary and the good ol' red hots are both delicious and unique as they opt for a slice of cucumber as opposed to a pickle. It hits the good ol' taste buds of a red hot but is considerably Fat Johnnies. It's worth your time and effort to venture in the Southside (and really the neighborhood isn't all that bad if you go in the daylight hours).Again, the place is dirt cheap. I went with my girlfriend and my dad and we all ate like royalty for $10. He had a Chicago dog as did I and I also had a polish. My girlfriend got the mother-in-law. There is only a bench to sit on and it isn't really shaded. Your best bet is to get your food and enjoy it in your air-conditioned car with a Mexican bottle of coke. There's limited parking in front of the establishment but you could also park at the Popeye's nearby.If you do go, enjoy a true, unique, and fantastic taste of Chicago hot dog cuisine.

50.description: I decided to check this spot out after researching it online before a business trip to Chicago.  It is definitely off the beaten path but worth the trek.  I had the chili dog and the nachos.  Both were excellent and you can't beat the prices.  I will be back next time I am in Chicago...

4.description: Fat Johnnie's gives it to you straight.  Hot dogs and tamales and chips and soda, all of which is pretty cheap and pretty damn tasty, especially the chili dog I took down a few days ago with a bag of Jay's BBQ chips and a root beer.  (Total: $4.25.)  The shack isn't much to look at but I was able to snag the one picnic table next to the shack to enjoy this meal.  I wish this was closer but it was worth the ride.

6.description: Finally made it to this spot! Enjoyed the Mighty Dog in all of its splendor and it was surprisingly light given the ingredients. Highly recommend stopping here if you find yourself in Marquette Park. I found myself wondering what the Mighty Dog would taste like if they used the tamale corn husk instead of a hot dog bun. It might be a nice development for those who want to cut back on their carbs, as well as do further justice to the ingredients that make this dog special.

22.description: Let me be upfront and say, "Yes, It is a  dive, Hot Dog Shack." But don't let the looks fool you! And if you haven't seen it yet, this place was voted by TWO  Major Magazines as the best Hot Dog in the USA ! Ranked number one over some major Hot Dog Joints.Bottom Line: Get the "Mighty Dog" or "Mighty Polish." It is insane! Hot Dog with Cheese Sauce, Chili Sauce, Cucumber Slice, Tom Tom Tamale, Tomatoes, Onions, Sport Peppers............God , I'm getting hungry just by writing this.And, Every time I go there without fail, they are so very courteous. They keep calling me "Sir" and I keep looking around see who they're talking too. LOLBest "Dog" in the good ol' U.S. of A. and Polite to boot! Go get yourself some!

15.description: Oh Boy, you're for a treat when it comes to the amazing Fat Johnnie's.Often times mistaken as a dump or an abandon RV.  If you judged a book by it's cover, you would be so sadly mistaken on this account.This place is the Gem of the Southside Chicago.  It looks like you got the wrong place, but trust me you didn't.I like Fat Johnnie's for their Chili Cheese Dogs... these are the best I've ever had.  And, I try a lot.I think Fat Johnnie claims to have been the inventor of the Chili Cheese dog, and so do about 10 other places.  But, that doesn't matter they do them right.Now the neighborhood is bad, I used to live in Marquette Park area, and would come out here whenever I could.  But, even though it's bad don't let that change your opinion about this place.  Just go when it's light outside and you will not have anything to worry about.  Except the occasional homeless person asking for money.  Don't show fear and you have nothing to worry about.I was talking to a friend once about this place and they said... "Oh yeah, Fat Johnnie's, I was mugged there before... Can't wait to go back."  That makes me giggle whenever I think about it.You can not find another dog anywhere with as much character and flavor as this place. Go, you won't be disappointed.  Even if you get mugged.

57.description: If you aren't afraid of sitting outside on picnic tables no matter the weather while eating a hot dog wrapped in a tamale with cheese and possibly chilli, then this is your spot. I had a couple of dogs, both the mighty dog (minus the chilli) and a regular dog with everything (including the tasty cucumber spiced with celery salt). I also tried the "suicide" drink which basically tasted like dr pepper or root beer which I probably would never get again. Otherwise this is a great classic spot that everyone should check out at least once if you like any of the above...

20.description: For the first time in forever I ordered dogs with everything.  I never do that.  And these were pretty good.  Mustard, onions, relish, tomato, cucumber (no peel), and celery salt.  Well done.  No fries, but I don't really need them anyway.  There's some picnic tables outside.  If I ever get back to the area I'd try a Polish or something, but you can't go wrong with their dogs.The neighborhood is the neighborhood.  It's Chicago, not Naperville.  Get over it.  One thing I will say is that if you park on Western, be careful the traffic because the lanes are getting re-painted or something so there's very little room between the driving lane and the parking lane.

36.description: Still good, and it  was cool to see this place on Bourdain. The nearby area is typical to what you might find around Midway Airport.  So if you're that big of a pussy, then I'm sure the hot dog stand at Orlando Square Mall or Woodfield will suit you juuuuuuuust fine & you dont have to worry about wetting your pants in fear.

14.description: Best hot dogs in the city. Don't be afraid of the location or the dirtiness of the place. It adds character.

0.description: You have to be careful, for all Harold's are not created equal.  This one, however, is good.  Haven't been in a couple of years, but in the early millennium, they had it going on.  Food dropped fresh, well-balanced sauce, and plenty of it.

3.description: Very delicious family owned restaurant with delicious pizza along with all the other food here. From the wings to the hot dogs or burgers de Arcos offers good food for a good price. & they have huge slices of pizza. Deff will be back.

1.description: One of my favorite cheap pizza place. Yeah. I only go there for the pizza n is huge n good.

2.description: 23 minutes for 6 cheese sticks that was supposed to only take roughly 4 minutes according to the cashier? Then they turned out to be just less than okay, especially since there was very little marinara sauce in my cup. I guess. That's what I get because I truly had no business eating them in the first place.

5.description: Good pizza. Delivery time was about 35 mins! Fast. Cheesy cheese. Sauce a bit sweet....sorry short

6.description: We have been ordering from this place *at least* twice a month for the past 3 years. The service has been getting more and more lax, and we just don't have the time or patience to deal with it anymore.Last night's scenario: I call to place an order for pick up. The owner himself takes the order. I ask when we should be there to pick it up, and he says, "20 minutes." I repeat to him, "20 minutes?" and he confirms it.My boyfriend and I decide to arrive in 30 minutes instead because our last few pick up orders have never ready by the time we arrived, and we hate waiting an extra 10-15 minutes for something that should be ready for pick up.We arrive, and the food isn't ready. I mean, how hard is it to have pre-made lasagna, chicken salad and breaded mushrooms ready in 30 minutes when there is no one in the dining area and no one waiting around for pick up orders?!When my boyfriend tells the owner that 1) we ordered 30+ minutes ago and were told that the order would be ready in 20 minutes and 2) we've been long time customers, the owner just starts arguing with my boyfriend. What. The. Hell. ?!. So we leave and decide to spend our money elsewhere.The girl who usually takes our orders calls me a half hour later to apologize for the fiasco. 1) The apology was too late for me to receive it graciously and 2) it probably wasn't a sincere apology since it wasn't from the owner himself, but at least she understands the idea of damage control.I don't know what is wrong with the owner of this place, but after last night we are never ordering anything from this place again and encourage others not to either.

0.description: I love the pizza specially on Friday , seems like who ever is in the kitchen on Friday does a better job. But I have to WARN you that I've ordered last night 01/18/2016 and the young lady asked for too much information on my Debit card, this has never happened before.( CSV # and zip code) since my number has been stolen before this caused a RED FLAG. So unless this is a new practice I caution you not to give this information out. I will no longer be ordering over the phone. I do hope someone looks into this and responds to me.847-463-5290

4.description: Aside from Pizza Hut this is the only other pizza place I eat from. But I had it with the young dumb cashiers they keep hiring. The one girl with the buck teeth is extremely rude, I don't know if it was because she was pregnant or not but she was literally minutes away from being slapped. Normally I don't write these kind of reviews but she pissed me off. First off she act like she didn't want to take my money saying that it was fake, of course I told her I got it straight from the bank which I did but she still didn't take it. I saw her use the marker which verified my money was real and she still didn't accept it.  Then she goes to pass my money around to the kitchen staff in front of everybody completely embarrassing and them says no  not taking it and hands me my money then move to the next customer. I quietly left the restaurant went across the street to deposit the same money at a CURRENCY EXCHANGE  who accepted the bill with no problems. So I went back to dearcos and let her know what happened no apology no nothing I ordered my food and left. After this I will no longer eat here I've been dining here for about 10 years but after this incident they will no longer get my money it's a shame because a few of the other girls are so sweet and professional but you can tell this one chick had no proper training and a shitty attitude and trust every customer won't be as mature as me and just walk away without either cursing her or even further physically harming her after the way I was treated.

3.description: HORRIBLE!!!! Do not order delivery from here!!!!!I ordered Sesame Chicken and it tasted/smelled like Orange Chicken with some sesame seeds on it. The BBQ Pork was super fatty. (One of my coworkers actually said, ohh did you get Orange Chicken?)The man who delivered called me to let me know that he was here was very rude on the phone and yelled at me 'I'm here, where are you'. Literally 15 seconds later the business called me to tell me he was here, I told them I know that he was here, I told them I know I literally just got off the phone with him and they hung up. I work in a healthcare setting so I have to take an elevator (I put in the directions to call when here). He took my money and walked out of the building, didn't even say thank you for the tip that I gave him. I will never order from this restaurant and I will make sure to let people know to not give them business.The only thing that wasn't bad from this place was the mango smoothie (with everything else being how it was I was worried it was going to be melted and probably gross).

1.description: From what my wife has explained to me, we actually tried this restaurant back in 2012, and I became upset because we spent damn near $30, and they didn't give us any free egg rolls. Well tonight my wife went back to the South China Kitchen 2, and I'm not happy with what we have purchased. Bottom line, everything is bland!! BLAND!!!! I normally never have to use any Soy Sauce! Well I had to use 10 packs on my Egg foo yung, the chicken fried rice, and the chop suey! The Chop Suey was the biggest disappointment because it cost damn near $7, and it was so damn bland!! We usually go to Hoe Toy on 86th and Stony Island. We've been going there for years! The only reason we didn't go today is because my wife was over near the South China Kitchen 2, and she figured she'd give it another try. We don't believe in throwing food away so it will be eaten. But please believe, we won't be going back!

2.description: This is typically my go to spot for Chinese food especially since you can't get that Chicago Chinese food flavor anywhere else! Well this time I was in town and called in for a delivery because I was exhausted but had a mean hankering for Egg Foo Young(sp). My Mother's address was on file under my number, but I told them the address of location at the time. Nevertheless they delivered to my Mother's house and when the delivery guy called and said he was outside and I didn't see him I figured he had gone to my Mother's house. So I informed him that he was at the wrong address and he RIPPED ME A NEW ONE! So I definitely didn't want my food anymore... What if he spit in it!?! So I told him on the phone to take it back to the store and give me a refund. Then the woman at the store ripped me a new one for requesting a refund! But I got my refund and vowed to never spend a dollar there!

5.description: The service is horrible they I ordered food last night and they forgot my fried rice, I called back and they never picked up! They currently owe me Five dollars because I never got my food!

6.description: Same experience as Arvetta on Grub Hub delivery order.  Driver called saying he couldn't find house.   Then, the driver left his car parked diagonally in the middle of the street. I've never seen anything like it.   I had to walk out in socks to get the order.   I showed him my large lit address sign.   The food was bland, so I'll skip.

7.description: TERRIBLE DELIVERY SERVICE!! We ordered from them through grubhub and the transaction went through smoothly; however when the delivery driver called to inform us he was outside he was nowhere to be found. He insisted he was at the correct address and when we tried to offer assistance he was resistant and called me several names. After about 15 minutes of phone tag, bewilderment (on the drivers end) and more name calling the driver finally showed up with cold food in hand. He had the wrong address all along, didn't apologize for the confusion and after all this mess was almost over he didn't want our tip "I don't want your money!!!" were his exact words. NEVER will I order from them again. If I want run of the mill american chinese food I'll go further down Western to See Thru China Kitchen.

8.description: I love vegetable tempura and even though it's not on the menu, they make it here for me and it's awesome and delicious.

9.description: This restaurant has TERRIBLE customer service! I had THE WORST experience last night with my delivery. I ordered through GrubHub, ( I highly recommmend they should STOP doing business with this restaurant.) it took about 2 hours for the delivery to come. When the delivery driver showed up he yelled over the phone "Delivery OUTSIDE." I go downstairs (I live on the 3rd floor in my apartment) in my house shoes thinking he would at least come to the door. He stayed in the car and screamed "I DONT GET OUT OF THE CAR." There is water puddles, snow, and ice from my front door, to the car. He expected me to step in PUDDLES, in my house shoes to come to his car to get the food that I PAID FOR. This was the WORST experience I have ever had with a food delivery. When I told him I could not come to the car he threatened to drive off. If my neighbor didn't walk into my apartment complex and offer to walk to the car for me, I wouldn't have received the food that I paid for. Long story short. The delivery driver is a rude little man who needs to work in the back of the restaurant and not deal with customers. Then when I called to complain on him. The person over the phone said "sorry, he is afraid of the area." WTF??? He has the WRONG job! Im extremely dissatisfied and will NEVER order from this place again.

0.description: My new fav chinese food takeout spot. Ordered the orange chicken lunch combo with an order of chicken wings on the side. Blew away my expectations. Best orange chicken I've ever tried. Perfectly crispy, the sauce was perfect and it came with broccoli to my surprise. The fried rice was great. The wings... holy shit, cooked to perfection, and so delicious.

4.description: The customer service was discussing. If they don't care about how they talk to you, how can they care about how well they take care of their food. Never trust eatting from a place where people are mean for no reason. That's just like asking for food poisoning. I called to place a phone order and this was my first time ordering there, I asked for extra shrimp and when she gave me my total it didn't add up to me so I kindly asked her what was the break down of the price and she huffed and said "you don't know tax?! Then yelled  spelling out the word T A X!" I was very shocked because I didn't do anything for her to say it to me that way, so I simply said I was just asking because I've never ordered from you guys before and I'm not familiar with your prices and then she said to me " You think I like you like that, I don't like you like that " that was enough for me to ask her to just cancel my order. I would not advise anyone to eat anything from here. That energy and bad atmosphere can and will rub off on your food as well as they just may not even care how well they take care of their food if they feel that behavior was okay to have towards anybody. This was just a simply sad experience.

1.description: This Village Discount Outlet was just a plain hot mass!  You can literally skip this location if you want to.  Trust me, you won't miss out anything even if there's a half-off sale going on.  There is a plenty of locations that are much better than this one.  I was wondering around women's, toddler's, and men's departments for about ten (10) minutes, attempting to find the rack containing Blazers and light jackets.  I'm usually very self-sufficient and directionally-savvy.  Guess what?  I couldn't locate them, even though I found some at the end.Hubby said he saw one (1) single vinyl record in the store.  That really improved the point that there is no need to travel all the way down to Chicago Lawn, unless you live in the neighborhood and have some time to kill.  I do have some spare time on my days off from work, but I got to use my time wisely.  My suggested locations for Village Discount Outlet are the one on W. 26th. (Little Village) and in Bucktown by CTA Western Blue line (O'Hare branch).

2.description: This place has decent selection and good prices, but their workers are just angry.  They are crazy about where you hang clothes, even to sort and I have been yelled at when I commented about who would pay $60 for an ugly denim jacket.

0.description: I love thrift stores. I love them so much I want to marry them and have little thrifty babies with them. But Im  thrift snob. Northside thrift stores in fancy ass hoods are so picked over by hipster stores looking to fill their storefronts with cool shit that trendy people will buy for 10x the amount they pay for it. Lame!The best thrift stores are the ones that are dark,with flickering flouresent lights, rickety carts jacked from grocery stores, workers that dont speak english and dont wear emo haircuts. This is easily one of teh best evar. Who knows what you might find? I have found so much crazee shit here and its all like a dollar. yeah, its dirty, its far away and its a little bit scary, but its the bomb ass junk.

3.description: Love tacos villa! Great service  and even better food! . My favorite  spot for quesadillas! I've  only ever had their quesadillas.  I would one day like to try more food but i can never pass up a quesadilla de picadillo with red salsa!. Only things that suck are cash only and no parking.  Oh and their hours are very weird so call first.

1.description: Hole in the wall?????  Hell yea..Small place with about 10 or so seats at the counter, no tables, no waiter, no fancy table cloths or silverware. Used to come here a lot, not quite sure why I stopped. About a month ago a friend who used to live here in Chicago was coming back and called me to have lunch with him. I asked him where did he want to go and he said the following:" Remember the small Mexican restaurant on the southside that has great quesadillas and killer chilaliquiles""Sorry not sure which place you are talking about" i replied.And he continiues: " the place by 63 where the people there are super nice and helpful" Dude be more specific, I said. We can go anywhere else.He wasn't going to have that: "great quesadillas and chilaliquiles, great customer service, small place by 63rd and Kedzie.Are you talking about Tacos Villa???Yes that one. So... we went there that day and he asked me to text him the address the next day.

2.description: Small neighborhood restaurant.    Only has about ten stool around the counter.  No other sitting is available to dine in.    The food is Mexican authentic food with flavor.     Well worth my trip into the city.  .   I highly recommend it !!

5.description: When the BF first brought be here, I was kinda insulted. At first glance is just a hole in the wall, but it's actually a hidden gem.  I am addicted to their chicken sopes.  Addicted I tell you.  They add a little bit of potato to their chicken, which adds a little different texture, and it works.  The flavor of their food is top notch. I can't comment on the other meats, but the BF orders everything they have and raves about the place. In fact, at one we came here every day straight for like five days in a row (we really need to get some business, but I was not complaining!!) And let me not forget the horchata.  I'm an horchata snob.  I like the homemade stuff, not the cinnamon laden, ready made crap that alot of places try to pass off.  Tacos Villa's horchata is one of the best in the city, in my humble opinion.  Creamy, light and the real deal.  And everything's really reasonable.  For two people, we've never spent more than $10, and he eats ALOT.

6.description: This is a really great taqueria - I like it the food a lot more than Los Comales across the street.  When I choose between the two, I have to say Los Comales across the street is better if you want to sit and relax, but if it's just about food, I go here.  The tacos seem cheaper, but they have less meat - they mix in fried potatoes with the chicken.  Fine with me - it's about the same value as most other taquerias.   The seating is diner style, and you get to watch them make your food for you (which is fun if you're ordering something healthy).  Very tiny, close knit, sociable atmosphere - you can't help but have a conversation with the people around you, as well as the people who work there.  Super cute place.  Definitely a family atmosphere.

7.description: Great food, great service. Do not judge a book by its cover.  I actually like the bar seating.  The owners are the people that are serving you and they are very friendly.  Their menu is very extensive.  Just ask they can probably cook it.

8.description: I like Bebe and I go here a lot to lunch on their flavorful mexican take out. Their steak tacos and chicken enchiladas are quite good. Their refried beans stand out because they are lighter and smoother than in your regular mexican fare. They don't taste as "unhealthy" as far as frijoles go. Also a big favorite of mine are their chicken sopes. Very tasty little deep-fried biscuit with frijoles shredded chicken, pechuga queso y crema. Muy delicioso! That's just how good it is.

9.description: Ok at first glance you wouldn't even consider walking into this place.  On the outside it looks like some shack with a kitchen.  The seating is horrible, just a bar with stools, no tables and seating is limited.  You'll think twice about wanting to order food at this place but the place is always packed!  Why?  The food is great!  The tacos are one of the best I've ever had and I'm picky when it comes to tacos.  The chicken tacos are my favorite next to the al pastor.  My brother LOVES their menudo, the gorditas are good and the chilaquiles are in this rich sauce that only mom can make.  It's not a great place to take kids becuase of the seating arrangements but you can order to go although I've never ordered to go from this place just because this food you want to eat fresh from the source, soggy tacos are not my thing but give it a try.  It's really cheap food and really great tasting.  The place is family owned and run.   We drive quite a bit for their food.They really need to expand!!!

0.description: I've been going here since I was a little kid and all I can say is this place has the best authentic Mexican food!

4.description: There are several things that are unpleasant, and examining other people's moldy basements is one of them. That was what had my coworker and myself had been doing for most of the morning. We had been fueled by the vision of the tacos we would eat after our third home visit, and Tacos Villa was fulfilled our fungus-influenced expectations. Though the small restaurant was a little toasty on the hot afternoon, we were comfortable on a bar stools watching our orders take place eyes watering and noses itching. Sometimes, you just need to zone out watching a guy use a masa press and look at a map about the breweries of Mexico. I ordered a chicken sope, rice and beans, and an horchata. The Horchata was thin, cold, not too sweet, and really cinnamon-y, the signs of an excellent horchata. The yellow rice and refried beans were served in a little boat-shaped dish. These were so much better than so many rice and beans I have eaten so many times- perfectly cooked and slightly garlic-y, they stood on their own, enhanced by the vinegary-green and funky-red salsa that came on the side, but not needing that accompaniment. My chicken sope was a delicately arranged tower. I usually avoid sopes because they are messy and sometimes the tortilla-base-thing sucks, but this was the opposite of that. The deep-fried base was crispy, delicate- Hugh's S. Description of "biscuit" is not off the mark. The pollo top came in big, lean pieces, well marinated and cooked. Sometimes, ordering pollo is asking for shredded skin and fat with zero percent seasoning, but this chicken was had a flavor somewhere between curry and mole- a perfect contrast to the crunch of the biscuit and lettuce. A Note! They do not have chips or avocado.  If these are food items are requirements for you, you need to expand your palate but you're not going to be happy here.   As I look back on my recent visit to Tacos Villa, I am filled with kindheartedness and a sense of nostalgia. This is probably because I was having a low-dose mushroom trip, but also because this was delicious food in a welcoming environment. The three employees were polite, friendly, and focused on the amazing food they were crafting for regulars as well as these two allergic gringas. Highly recommended.

0.description: Classic Chicago experience.  I've yet to go here looking for something i did not find.  From live bait to electronics, there must be at least 4 separate businesses running in here.  I like to think of it as the littlest flea market.  Some people seem to think it's shady, but i've always been greeted with a smile and treated with respect.Most recently my bf was craving popcorn and i said, oh, i'll just run to JJ Peppers, and he was like, oh, you're crazy, they are not going to have popcorn, cuz we only like the pan poppin kind not the microwave kind, and i was like, oh yeah, well we'll see.  And of course they had it.Big 'ol parking lot, too.

3.description: The epitome of home cooked food! The wait staff is what truly makes this place, in my opinion.

1.description: WOW SHAME ON ME! I've lived in this neighborhood for years and as one reviewer stated ' I too have walked past this restaurant' without giving regards to it & i apologize for that because just because it's located in the a busy area of this city doesn't mean the food isn't good; See people that's the ignorance of "JUDGING A BOOK BY IT'S COVER "!!! I really can't give a true rating yet because I haven't eaten there yet, but since this is my last week in Chicago- i will try it today and give a higher rating after my encounter with the food. As for now, jus because the owner/owners thought enough about the neighborhood people to place a business for our benefit- im giving it four stars!!!!  I cook only when i need to and now i read about a place serving SOUL FOOD AND BREAKFAST- NO MORE " WALK ON BY" for me; see you soon Granny B's.

2.description: I have walked past this place for so many years and never went in. I 'm glad that I finally decided to stop in today. I picked a breakfast of scrambled eggs, bacon and hash browns. My eggs were perfect and the hash browns were delicious. They were not your frozen preformed crap that many places try to pass off as real.  It's a no frills type of spot. I knew it was real when I ate the toast. I usually leave it off because I'm a little funny when it comes to bread but I actually wolfed it down with the rest of the food. Things to know:Eat in or take out the waitresses were nicethe prices are very reasonablethey are open from 7-4they have Sunday dinners starting at $7.95it's cash only I plan to return and pick up some dinners for my Granny and I.

5.description: Great food with that home cooked feel only Granny can do!

6.description: I went here 3 times for my stay in Chicago, my cousin lives on the Southside, this was our go-to place when we were hanging in the Southside. First off, the service was great and friendly. Second, the food didn't take long to get out, and 3rd it was delicious to my tastebuds. Day 1: Got the 6 piece wings and fries. Day 2: Got the smother pork chops and Day 3: I got the liver and onions. All dishes were really good, btw and priced very well. Ps. they serve soul food on Sundays!

7.description: we order lots of food and the bill is 21 dollar thats the deal. we went there on tuesday and a server she so nice to us. this place make me feel like am eating at my grandma house that why i gave 5 star

0.description: The smothered chicken was Y-U-M-M-Y! Made fresh to order, I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu.

4.description: My wife and I were in Chicago visiting and stopped in for breakfast. It was a very welcome change from the typical chain restaurants. The food was plentiful and inexpensive. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The only regret is not being able to go there on Sunday for Soul Food Sunday. Next time we are not going to miss it! Thank you Jimmy Senior. See you later

1.description: Nasty!had their chicken that tasted like it was 2 days old.They got the chicken with their bare hands, out of a cooler and put it on the grill to warm t up and served it to me.

0.description: MMMmmm their salsa is so good it makes you wanna drink it out of the molcajete. Seriously it's my favorite.. I can just eat their chips and salsa as a meal and be happy. I don't because then my GERD will unleash it'd unholy wrath upon me and that's no fun. :/ According to the signs everywhere, the chicken is the way to go so there I went. I had 1/4 of the char-broiled chicken w/ double rice (no beans) and salad. The chicken is juicy and not over-seasoned. I get my food to go so I can't comment on the waitresses.It's terribly out of my way but I was in the neighborhood so I went back. This time I was in the mood for tacos. I had the steak tacos and luckily no cubes of fat. WIN! They' weren't huge but I had two and I felt comfortable. The price was decent $3-4. They didn't have Sidral on this particular visit so left kicking stones. The place is kinda small but the decor is fun. They also have a parking lot right across the alley. The only downside is the location. The neighborhood tends to get kinda lonely in the night. If you live on the southside I suppose you can get delivery but if you're a northsider like me, plan on a day trip.

3.description: Food is okay but it's literally like a crack house on the inside,service sucks just really needs a all around remodeling

1.description: Zero stars if possible! The dinning area is filthy. Customer service is terrible and have no idea what they are doing. If you order online they won't get your order for some reason (probably bs). Don't know how this place is still open? It would be run better by a wild pack of wolves.

2.description: Worst service ever ! They have a terrible attitude and show no respect for their customers. There just lucky I couldn't put zero stars

5.description: I hadn't had Pizza Hut in a looong time and wanted to try their new ultimate stuffed crust pizza.  I don't know why it took them so long to add the meats in the crust with the cheese but I'm glad they finally did.  Maybe it was because I haven't had Pizza Hut in a while, but the pizza was delicious.  I'd give this place five stars but I phoned the order in for carry out and they told me 20 minutes and I still had to wait about 5 after I arrived before it was ready.  They should under-promise and over-deliver.  Still not a big deal as the cashier apologized and was very friendly.

6.description: When I was a kid my family would go here everytime I got a coupon for a free personal pan pizza for reading books at school. The venue was nice and the waitresses very hospitable. We always ordered the supreme pizza and it was pretty good. This Pizza Hut in particular makes a higher quality pizza than other Pizza Huts. Stopped by recently and the pizza's are still like I remember them.

0.description: The poor girl at the front was the only girl answering phone calls, cleaning tables and helping customers.  They where pretty busy when I came in and can't understand why she would have to do it all alone! The pizza makes in the back kept yelling at her and being rude to her. The pizza was ok. The service was delayed because they where super busy and only one person at the front. I give an A for effort. But we prob won't come here again. L

4.description: TERRIBLE customer service.. at first, there was a woman with THE worst attitude working the front counter. Now, the gentleman they have is VERY polite BUT, the young lady(and I use that term loosely) that cooks, this was on the night of 9/28 had the audacity to tell this young man what she WASN'T cooking! I mean, this is 7pm, they don't close until 9pm. How are you NOT trying to make certain pizzas because they take too long. And EVERY time you go, there's always an employee on the sideline having personal conversations with a friend.. I mean, you're working! Smh. This location needs stricter management. Just because it's located in the "hood" doesn't mean it should be run that way. No "thank you, sorry about your wait time" NOTHING! The ONLY reason I return, is because it's closer. Last night was the final visit there for me though..

1.description: Went in during breakfast hours and they didn't have eggs available.

0.description: The staff seems very unfriendly, always on their phones and I have to keep repeating myself. The sandwiches are fine, but it would be a lot easier and faster if they could really pay attention to the customer, and I really hate that annoying 5 inch plasti-glass, it's hard enough trying to communicate with someone who is having a conversation on their cell phone on how to make a sandwich, now you got this wall with badly drilled and placed holes for communication.

3.description: Not the best, but if you just want a cup of coffee I think it will do! I've never had a problem w/ the staff. But I have to admit if I order something other than coffee theres always something wrong or they give me someone else's order.

1.description: For a 24 hour Dunkin, the inside is always closed at night and there's rarely any donuts. Why is this place still in business ?

2.description: I was driving through and decided to get an iced coffee.Cashier was nice and friendly. Got my iced coffee and was in and out within a few minutes.

5.description: The employees are horrible!! They always get something wrong & then get mad when you want them to fix it. One of the girls yelled at me through the drive through. After I got my order, I had to go back and go in because of course, they didn't give me what I asked for. The same girl got an attitude, rolled her eyes, and snatched the bag out of my hand. They're rude, lazy, and ignorant.If it's not your last option on the way to work, please don't go in here!!

6.description: What a shitty place. I went in at 9:45 am seeking a bagel and hash browns. It wasn't crowded, and there was an employee standing near the register, but at least a minute went by before anyone deigned to pay me any attention. My bagel was barely warmed up, and the order of hash browns was short. I was given ONE pack of ketchup and ONE napkin with my order. JFC, take your money elsewhere; this establishment doesn't do a thing to earn it, and Dunkin' Donuts is too ubiquitous anyway for customers to endure such poor service.

0.description: Best dunkin ever! I love getting doughnuts from this dunkin the staff is really kind and quick my orders are almost always right there has been a few times that my order wasn't right but I just went back so they can fix it no big deal :)

4.description: How is it possible to give double D a bad review...uh when they make watered down burnt tasing coffee. Yes this is the place to go if you like that flavor. Not me!

3.description: I gave this place a couple of visits because one visit is never enough to gauge a good feeling for it. On weekdays it's pretty dead, with just the TV's playing in the background. On weekends they seem to regularly host private parties which means service will be pretty subpar (unless of course you're a guest of the private party). You can test out the waters on your own, but there are far better Mexican Restaurants in the area.

1.description: I'm visiting from Los Angeles and my aunt brought my siblings and I here. The food was great! I had the Arrachera a la Tampiqueña, an enchilada with Mole, chips and guacamole... ALL had wonderful flavor. I had a Tequila Sunrise and it was prepared perfectly. I loved the atmosphere and service--very friendly and accommodating. If you want great REAL Mexican food, this is the place for you.

0.description: This is my first time here and let me tell you the food was good.  I had Carne a la Tampiqueña and the meat was very tender and juicy. They have home made tortillas.

2.description: I Called around 8 30 pm on a Wednesday night because yelp says this business delivers. The lady who answered presented herself "for here or to go." When I asked for delivery she totally changed her tone and said they didnt deliver..so upset.

5.description: Great service. Great food. Enchiladas are the best! I just wish they would serve a little bit more rice. Karaoke night on Friday and Sundays! I love it here! I come often.

6.description: I've been here about 5 to 6 times I'd say and each time is pretty bad from the service from the waitresses to the food and pick-up. Usually we'd be poorly attended. Seems like they pay less attention if you're not a regular. Food was served very slow. Took about half an hour to get two simple tacos so they were very cold. The waitress that we got on one night was very rude and honestly made us never come back. Oh, and pick up? More like dine-in since they never wrote down my order.

7.description: A place that doesn't get too much press but is well worth it. After new management took over, the food and service got way better. Everything I've tried her is to die for and their prices are reasonable.  There's a Cocula's not too far from this restaurant and their savor doesn't even compare to Cinco Estrellas.  They also serve alcohol for those who are interested. Seriously, if you feel like venturing out to the south side and trying some delicious Mexican food, go there!!!

8.description: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the south side of Chicago. From the hand made tortillas to their fresh waters everything here is great. They sell beer and its a big restaurant which is great cause you usually never have to wait. Not a lot of people know about it but you won't regret trying it. 5 stars!

9.description: One of the most authentic Mexican restaurant I have ever been to in Chicago area...hands down...best there is.We had a great afternoon here and I would highly recommended

10.description: This restaurant has very AUTHENTIC Mexican feel of a restaurant , i have been there 3 times in the last month, and loved everything! the have the cheapest and most delicious mexican breakfasts!!   for like $6  you have choice of eggs! (not even at mickie D's you get something like that) with handmade corn tortillas (although they also have flour tortillas if you like your breakfast more Tex-Mex style) I highly recommend this place for steaks ( and fish too!) everything is delicious. And if you are the kind of person who likes to be entertained while you dine, theres DJ, live music and dancing on weekends (they also have a jukebox) This place is awesome, this is the place I go for my Mexican food fix ;)

4.description: I tried the steak nachos and tacos the tacos were real good homemade tortillas which I really liked I will for sure try this place again.

0.description: Great chicken at great price. Ordered chicken for catering for 50 people under $250 got quality and quantity. Guacamole is excellent. They deliver which is a plus.

1.description: I have used Christina's Sweet Creations for many family celebrations.  They include my daughter's baptism, my best friends bridal shower, and even for gifts for my daughter's teachers. I have ALWAYS been EXTREMELY happy with what she has created and have recommended her to many of my other friends and family. I plan on using her for my daughter's first birthday. I can't wait to see what her extremely, creative and genius mind comes up with. Everything has always been on time, she does have great service and great prices and can create any type of design you explain or give to her. You should give her a try!!

2.description: Great service, great prices, the delivery was on time. The decoration on the cake was beautiful. The bread was a little dry but it might have been the type of cake i chose. Def. A must try!!

0.description: I have ordered from Christina multiple times and she never dissapoints. Her work is both beautiful and delicious. Her prices are great and delivery is always on time. I definitely would recommend you give her work a try.

3.description: Free food for....EVERYONE? Very Nice. God Bless you, Gamblers. Being in a pool league, I get to travel to different bars. I have been to my fare share of holes. This is a neighborhood bar fitted with a dart room, yes DART ROOM! The bar is pretty stardard but the service is outstanding. It gives me a homely feel to it. The man and woman behind the counter were friendly and inviting and constantly checking on the free food making sure everything gets rotated. The pool table was very well maintained and gave us players ample room to shoot. The have a giant dart room with maybe 6-7 dart boards for league also (i am guessing). This is an awesome neighborhood bar and great service and quality. Nothing too fancy but nice enough to not be a dive bar.

1.description: The neighborhood is not the best in the city but this is perhaps the best dart bar perhaps in the area. A local joint for the non immigrant community of Albany Park the place was decent enough although with its name perhaps four or more poker machines would of been appropriate

2.description: Ahhh... Good ole gamblers...

9.description: I started playing darts there early 2001 and have been a true regular ever since.  Jackie has to be the most conscientious bar owner in the city!  She has the most dart teams coming out of her bar than any other dart bar in the city, too.  Ray, Greg, Donna, and Dorothy are also the great bartenders.  She has her annual BitchFest in February that gathers all her ladies for a Sunday afternoon of fun/frolic/bitchiness (in the best way).

10.description: Gambler's is a PERFECT neighborhood bar.  Same faces for years which makes it so special.  Formerly, MONGO's and prior to that Blue Adriatic.  Wonderful bar staff (especially Ray). I only go a few times a year to reunion with old friends and family and I am treated as if I were there on a daily basis.  Tip well, they deserve it.

4.description: Cheap drinks, good juke box, friendly staff.  Thanks for the good times!

6.description: Staff is GRRRRRRRRRRRRRRReat!  Hey DJ...play that funky music white boy!  Cheap drinks and a pool table...can't go wrong

12.description: This is a very down to earth pub where the owner will personally serve you and make you feel welcome. They have a seperate room where they have live music once a month or so.
