The last time I went they didn't have many different things to eat, so you can go to one of the restaurants that are nearby if you like.

5.description: Gamblers is an Albany Park institution, long established as one of the finest dart bars in the city, the tradition continues on as flocks of darters will come far and wide to fling sharp pointy darts at their impressive row of darts again and again. One of the greatest things of being a Yelper and being in a dart league is that every other week I get to try out a usually new dart bar and get the opportunity to get into the nitty gritty and experience the best of what dives have to offer. Playing here on Tuesday night, Gamblers furnished us with a soup and salad buffet with plenty of chips and dessert. Who knew!? Random dive bars hook it up with the eats, joe!Having such a good time with their congenial and well-mannered team, me and my fellow teammates returned to Gamblers on a Saturday night to sharpen our teeth on the boards and to hang out. My friend ran into his co-worker who is in one of the higher level leagues and I saw plenty of Windy City Darters board members hanging out and shooting out.The Windy City Darters were having an official Nickel level qualifier and people were playing for some big money. Afterwards, they opened up a blind draw tournament and plenty of people played. I am always impressed with bars that still got the muscle to have Saturday night dart tournaments because it shows the robustness of the sport. At Gamblers there is no shortage of friendly northwestsiders and the Juke rarely stops playing.Over 40 dart trophies line their walls and people were playing all night. As we kept shooting until closing time, we were given free shots for keeping up the shooting. Seeing as how Gamblers is six blocks from my house , I can get myself used to playing marathon dart sessions with some of the best players in the city.

13.description: A place that caters to darts and is a great place for beginners and experts alike.  Plenty of dart boards (non-electronic) to choose from, and even during league nights, there are places to play.  While the place might seem creepy upon first entering, it isn't what it seems.   One might see a pathetic regular or two, sitting at the bar, watching the tv, but that isn't frequent.  Despite its relatively stark edifice, it's a great place with fun people - everyone laughs and hangs with their groups.  Pool costs a buck I think, and they have (I think) 6 steel-tip dart boards in the fantastic back room.  There's Golden Tee, an ATM, and a Millenium touch machine.  The bartenders are great, and Jackie, the owner, is the sweetest.

11.description: It's a hole in the wall, dive, neighborhood bar.  Once you've been there a few times, it's like you're family.  The bartenders are a trip and the owner is the sweetest... but don't you dare cross her!  If you're looking for a little bar that offers good music on the juke box, darts and regulars to chat with... I'd recommend gamblers!

8.description: This was a good find.  A friend and I stumbled upon Gamblers when we were an hour early for a dinner party.  The sign says "thirsty" under the name.  We were greeted with a warm welcome and the regulars were quite nice.  The prices were great too...$6.75 for a Makers rocks and Schitz...not too shabby.  If you ever find yourself in Albany park or looking to get drink before the strip club, Gamblers is the place to be.

0.description: Gamblers is the perfect place to grab a beer, watch the Blackhawks, Bears, Cubs, play pool or darts with friends and enjoy the evening. They have plenty or TVs, a couple pool tables and a whole room dedicated to darts. On Sundays they usually have free food. The bartenders are wonderful and the owner is awesome and the clientele is friendly.

7.description: Oh, dive bars, how I love thee!  Gamblers, you are about to become part of my regular haunts despite that I live nowhere near you.  I have not played darts in 10+ years, and I was never good at it.  I had so much fun here.  Even though my friends are really good at darts and so are the regulars, I felt oh so comfortable here.  Local bar, cheap, crappy beer by the pitcher, Kettle One, friendly staff and regulars who embrace newbies...perfect night.

3.description: This Salvation Army is not for everyone. If you're "uncomfortable" with this part of town, by all means stay away & shop more locally. Nothing here to really go out of your way for; I've found an unusually high amount of stained clothing and cracked, unwearable shoes here; the quality of the donations in general isn't that great. It isn't small, but it isn't terribly large. And don't be fooled by the staircase at the side of the store; it isn't accessible to customers. The best section may be the "leather goods" section (still don't understand why SA does this); you may find a decent leather jacket, but expect it to be somewhat inflated in price, SA style. All in all, meh.

1.description: Got there 10 minutes before 7pm (closing time), and had their doors locked.  I was looking for something very specific, was in the neighborhood, do not make it a practice to shop last minute.Many stores allow customers to go last minute, if anyone has to be that late, one must make it very quick.  This butch lady was paying for an item, they unlocked the door to let her out, and took upon herself to tell me they were closed, that she is the manager-was wearing a gold name tag the size of her ego, said they have families to go to, etc., impersonating a manager who leaves 10 minutes before their official hours, tallying up the day's receipts, etc.  She was a TRIP!    If a business, any business including thrift should respect the hours they have chose to operate.  I wonder if the real manager was there!

2.description: This Salvation Army Family store is an epitome of an old-fashioned thrift store.  What does that mean?  It means you need to dig in hard!  South side Chicago Salvation Army thrift stores don't really look too appealing stylistically, in comparison to the north side locations.  They also run a different sale and usually don't do the $0.69 color-tag sale on Saturdays.  The south side locations simply run the 50% off color-tag sale.  Thus, pay attention to the promotional signage when you come in. Anyways, the austere interior didn't deter me from searching for "treasures" in my book.  Although the vinyl section wasn't organized in a customer-friendly manner, we were able to find a "Chicago" (the band) and "the Pointer Sisters" vinyls for $4.32.  Well, hubby failed to confirm the match between the outer sleeve and the record itself.  So "the Pointer Sisters" one was, in actuality, a random R&B group that I've never heard before.  We played it and it was quite alright.  I wasn't too impressed by this Salvation Army thrift store location, but if you happen to be in this area, then stop by and check it out.  I think the neighborhood appeared safe enough during the day, but there is ample paid street parking.  Otherwise, the CTA 63 bus (63rd. St.) passes by if you want to utilize public transportation.

0.description: Old school thrift, merchandise turns over a little slowly, prices are generally good. They get interesting pieces of furniture in regularly, be sure to check that out, as well as their cd selection.

3.description: Lupita's florist was awesome. I contacted her after another local flower shop failed to deliver a birthday bouquet I had ordered early in the day for my sister. I was in Miami and my sister is in Chicago, down the  street from my sister. Within minutes she had secured payment and committed to delivery the order the same day...7pm was when I contacted her. Amazing!!! She saved me from a possible disasterous outcome. I will call her again for my mom's birthday flowers later this month. Thank you so much,  love, love, love them. Janet Cisneros

1.description: Lupita's Flower Shop makes AMAZING arrangements. I got married in 2013 in Chicago and I had paid another florist to do our flowers but she closed her shop without telling me.Of course I was panicking. I was then told about Lupita's Flower Shop, and I couldn't have had a better experience. Lupita and Francisco (the owners) immediately calmed be down and assured me they would take care of everything and deliver on their promise. All our wedding guests could not stop talking about how gorgeous our arrangements were for both the church and reception. They are extremely professional and attentive to their customers. Their flower arrangements are truly breathtaking and very reasonably priced given the HIGH QUALITY! They have gone above and beyond both for our wedding and for other events (business and personal). They never seize to amaze me. Out of all my experiences with flower shops, Lupita's, by far, is the best in all categories. I will NEVER trust going to another florist and will continue to give Lupita and her husband Francisco my business. If you live in Chicago and have an event here, I would not hesitate to give them your business. You will not be disappointed.

2.description: I've always bought my flowers from here. The service is wonderful and the people that work here are just amazing and friendly.

0.description: Lupita's Florist is amazing! We hired Lupita to provide all flowers for my wedding and they were absolutely breathtaking arrangements, boutonnieres, bouquets and everything! Her spirit is calm and relaxing and her execution is flawless. I recommend her without any hesitation! People are still talking about our flowers nearly six months later! Thank you Lupita and you entire team including your husband!

3.description: The last time I got an Onesti's Pizza was in the early 70's. I want some o' dat soooooooooooooooo bad!!!!!!!!!! I been on the West Coast so access is near impossible. Next time I'm in ChicagoLand I WILL GET A PIZZA!!!!!!! AT ONESTI'S!!!!! I just found out that they're still there!!!! YAY!!!!!!!!

1.description: Pizza was cold, delivery was slow.. The people work that was rude and the pizza was below average..

2.description: I don't understand how anyone gave this place 5 stars worst pizza ever ....I rather be hungry then eat here ever again ... The sausage taste horrible the mushroom were black!!! Burnt cause they cheaped us on the sauce... The sauce had no flavor I feel like they just opened a can of tomato paste and poured a few tablespoons...do not order pizza from here unless u like heartburn and a shitty aftertaste... Not even worth the one star I had to give them

0.description: Best pizza ever!!!!

4.description: Best pizza ever!!!! great crust, inexpensive, delicious sauce. I come here very often and have yet to be disappointed.I love this pizza!!!!

0.description: OK. Tonie the food was fresh cooked just right not over seasoned. Thanks to the Cook we are very happy. Now all they need is a working phone!!
Very impressed by the professionalism, timeliness and service!Great customer service and would definitely reorder and recommend!

1.description: If I could I would give this place no stars. You would think by serving so many ice cream cones they would know how to place a scoop of ice cream on a cone without breaking it and then giving it to you thinking you would be okay with it. The place is smelly too. Last time I will be going there.

2.description: Located at a corner in which businesses where doomed for failure since it's home to about it's 4th business in 3 years, this place really is everything that all the others weren't.  Awesome service, below average prices, and very tasteful products! Hope to have it in the neighborhood for a while!

0.description: I like this place my daughter love the ice-cream and it is just only $1.25 a scoop which is not bad at all, most places are a bit more.The people working here are very nice and friendly... Like the other yelper said it's like the 4th business here in 3 years hope this stays in my opinion is the best one..

3.description: I can't lie .... writing this review right now makes me want to go get a couple cheeseburgers. I love White Castles but the service, of course, varies from location to location. This one is pretty decent in terms of service and quality. I haven't had any bad experiences with the staff although they can seem a bit moody when taking your order in the drive-thru but for some reason by the time you get up to the window to get your food they seem to be real polite and hospitable lol. I never go in so i don't know what the place is like on the inside but this the White Castle that i frequent the most.

1.description: For what it is: A WHITE CASTLE. Its okay. Back in the day at my Bucktown home on the North Side we use to go to White Castle on Milwaukee and Armitage and this one reminded me of that. I go through the Drive Thru and it is really fast. They get your order and even are pleasant about it. I like when an employee smiles and says "Have a wonderful day" even if the day is gloomy and dank, this helps. They are just White Castle but I do go back all the time, it does help when you get treated well. PS: If you live in the neighborhood, USE THE COUPONS that they give you in the mail and get free items.

2.description: Although I'm usually not in this area, I found myself here while en route home after a funeral. Absolutely starving I decided to drive through  for a slider to hold me over until I got home for dinner.  I didn't expect much from the food, it's a white castle slider, they pretty much are the same everywhere.What was DIFFERENT about this white castle is that the woman working drive-thru was extremely courteous. My order was wrong even though it appeared correct on the drive-thru screen, but I didn't even call back to complain because the drive-thru personnel was so nice I wouldn't dare say anything that may get her in trouble. She had a smile in her voice and at the window.  Great job!

0.description: I went last week for some fries on my way to a work meeting and its right off the 49 Western bus stop. Its decent not a lot of hoodrats hanging out there orders taken quickly. It's clean but they need to keep the floors mopped since people spill a lot of stuff on the floors causing it to get sticky frequently. Good service overall.

3.description: Wow!  I finally ventured past Gurifuna Flava to check out Ray's Island Grill and I am soooo glad I did!!  Although this is a take out only spot, you have to take food this good home so that you can black out into your food coma after eating.  I ordered the Jerk Catfish with a sample of Jerk Wings to sample.  The fish and chicken was so well seasoned [not salty at all] I'm sure that they marinated it overnight.  With the dinner came rice and peas [excellent and tender, not dry like they've been on a steam table all day], streamed cabbage, and sweet plantain.  Absolutely fabulous!!  I am a customer for life!  Not only is this place close to my home, they are open 7 days a week AND they have Jerk Turkey Wings!!!!  Those who don't know better check this place out!  I will post pictures of their menu soon.

1.description: I saw this spot a few times before so I decided to give it a try today.  They need some assistance with the decor; it's dated, not much $$ spent.  The order taker had a thick accent, not the friendliest, but not rude.  The music station was great.  They offer daily specials unlike some of their competitors.  I looked online for menu but no luck.  It only took 15 mins for my jerk chicken dinner.  I carried it home.  The chicken wasn't that spicy which is good & bad, not all of us can handle some of those jerk spices.  The rice was ok, now that needed more umph.  The cabbage was dry, I'm not impressed.  The single plantain was cooked well done, not juicy like the other spots I visit.  The jerk sauce was ok, not too spicy, but decent.   This spot is one of those u go to when u don't feel like traveling to your usual spot.

2.description: Good food! Good music! Good prices! The guy on the truck is always friendly...just wish the young lady at the location was just as nice. Try the jerk tacos...You won't be disappointed!

0.description: I've passed by Ray's Island Grill a few times and finally decided to stop in and give them a try. I ordered the jerk catfish lunch. I'm not sure what it is lately with these cuts on the catfish steaks, but they're thin compared to what I'm accustomed to at Ja Grill, Jerk Villa and when Garifuna Flava used to carry catfish on there menu. Regardless, it comes with three pieces, red beans & rice, cabbages and plantains for $8.00. The one thing I didn't particularly care for was the cabbage because it lacked flavor, but everything else was exceptional. It was well worth the price and I'm glad I decided to visit. I'll definitely be dropping in more often and recommend them to others.

4.description: So glad I found this spot!! I've been searching for a long time for jerk chicken in my neighborhood without having to travel to the other side of town.  The food was good, the portions were large, and I have enough to take to lunch tomorrow.  The prices were normal for jerk restaurants, so no biggie.  I had a chicken dinner with rice and beans, and candied yams.  The yams were a little under cooked, but I still ate it! I'll be back!!

1.description: Martin is amazing! my 4yr old will not let anyone else cut his hair. he is also the only one that cuts it the way i like it.

0.description: Martin is the best....haven't let anyone else do my hair for the last 9 yrs!!

3.description: The ONLY thing wrong with this place is that they don't accept credit/debit cards. (But considering the neighborhood, that MIGHT be a good thing!)The waitstaff has always been very friendly and receptive. I love the fact that you do NOT have to be fluent in Spanish in order to order your food (and know what the heck you are eating!). The chips are great, the beans & rice are great...the enchiladas are to die for!! I'm also a vegetarian, and I've never had an issue ordering food "sin carne" (without meat). The waitstaff are bilingual (English and Spanish) and have no problems taking "special" orders. The "ambience" of the place is nothing special....there are booths, and they usually have Telemundo playing on the tv and there is a huge jukebox (that does work, yay!) and a few video games towards the back. If you are familiar with the neighborhood, the usual teenage crowd that comes in and out of there won't bother you. If you're not familiar with the 63rd street residents, then don't come alone. I've eaten at this restaurant late at night (after 8pm) with only my 5 year old daughter in tow, but then again, I know how to handle myself. If you want quick, fast and delicious Mexican food, this IS the place to go!

1.description: Been coming here for 30 years. This is the onlyplace to end an evening out in Chicago! Bad hood, great burritos!

2.description: Yea maybe not. It was around 3 in the morning and we were driving back from a bar . My friend was hungry( he is always hungry, lol) and this was the only place that was open so we decided to check it out. He ordered pork in red sauce and I ordered a steak burrito and a chorizo taco. I tasted his food and it was bland. the sauce was watery and the meat wasn't the best. beans and rice just bland. When it comes to my food, the burrito was just not that bad but not good either. The taco, I took a bite and put it down wishing I had never taken that bite, it was awful. My friend was a little drunk but I wasn't. maybe I need to get really drunk and give them another try. Yea not gonna happen lol. The service is just there. They are not rude, but they are not friendly. I guess it is understandable, midnight shift yea maybe not.

5.description: Ah, yes, I have spent many nights chowing on one of their steak burritos.  Talk about comfort food!   This all night burrito joint has some of the best mexican food coming out of a store front.  Beware late at night, however, as the crowd here can get a little rough, but if you can hold your own it's totally worth it!Be sure to try some of their horchata (or-CHA-ta)!!  It is heaven in a cup!  If you like rice pudding you'll love the horchata here!  For those of you who don't know what horchata is:  It's rice milk sweetened with sugar and flavored with cinnamon and almonds and is very delicious... can you tell that I like horchata?

6.description: UofC students know of this place.  Oh, they might not know the actual name (too busy learning about the Peloponnesian War), but they know it as "Burrito" - a great place to trek to when you're drunk.  And a trek it is.  You have to brave some pretty sketchy neighborhoods to get there, but it's totally worth it.  If you respect your burrito, you don't pierce it with utensils.  You simply rub it, love it, then scarf it down.  Oh, and if you're a football player, you eat 4 of them and don't ask about the contents.  Then, when you're middle-aged and sad, you drag your friends from the North Side to show them how geeks eat burritos.  I love this place!I just thought of the best part of El Gallo, there are no annoying LPTs holding up the line - talking on their cells.  They can't venture this far south - their BMWs would get stolen in a heartbeat.Tip:  If you're a vegetarian, learn how to order in Spanish or you'll find yourself on the receiving end of an all steak burrito.

7.description: Yeah the tarcos here are groot.  I usually go with my bardies to knouwnch on some and my favorite dishel that they harve is the carsardillos with choronzo.  Yarmy!

8.description: great taco's here (you can even buy a pack of cigs), there meat is nice and crispy, always fresh, and seasoned perfect. I've been coming here since the neighborhood was actually a nice place to live in. i still come here since i dont live to far. yes the neighborhood isnt great, but isnt  to bad if you come during the morning or early afternoon hours.

0.description: Best in town since I was a teen.  I'm now 52.

4.description: This place is legend.  I went over 300 times in college.  I was told by a guy that had grown up in the neighborhood that during the late 70's it was involved in a coke smuggling ring, taken over by the gov't and turned back into private bus. in the late 80's I reco getting the casadilla especial with steak and cilantro.  It comes with pablano, chiu. cheese, and onions.  I also reco getting the crema, which is whipped sour cream.  It's good on everything.  Cash only, don't go alone-

0.description: After trying many of their other bread, I must say that this is the best Mexican bread I have found so far in Chicago. They have these extremely delicious croissants that also have the sugary stuff found on conchas. All-in-all, you can't go wrong with any of the bread here, just make sure to get there early before they sell out of their best stuff.

1.description: I ordered a caramel iced coffee and they put absolutely no caramel and to top it off no whip cream! I'm sooo disappointed in dunkin because of this experience! And I tried to go back and ask them if they can add caramel and extra whopped cream and they asked for 25 cents! Like are you kidding me!!? You guys suck

2.description: Average Dunkin. Cool thing about this place is they have Baskin Robins and you can slice 2 birds with 1 samurai sword.

0.description: These girls know how to make their coffee

3.description: This Burger King has no concept of what is fast food. It's always Russian Roulette when I go in. Either there out if something or it takes 15-20 minutes to get your order. Wanted a coffee this morning and the girl didn't even acknowledge me. Just stood their taking orders at the drive through. Walked out. Horrible. They sometimes act like their doing you a favor. By the way, how do you run out of soda? Really?!

1.description: One of the top two worst Burger Kings i've been to. Their ability to mess up an order must be a superpower of theirs.Everything from order-taking skills to the whole "excuse me... can you please back up and then pull back forward" crap is ridiculous.One time i ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese croissant and ended up with value menu chicken sandwhich! I've been through plenty of drive-thru's and half a mile away only to realize that i didn't get what i ordered but this just baffled me. It was only a couple minutes after 9 am! What were they even doing making that kind of a sandwich that early?? I know you can get a Whopper early but a chicken sandwich from the value menu?? I was upset so i went back... The lady asked me if i wanted some french fries for the mixup lol. Yeah ... that's what i had taste for .... a bacon, egg, and cheese croissant and french fries lol.

2.description: I never had a problem here.always got what I expected and customer service was    acceptable.only complaint is that soda machine isn't kept up with properly(i.e. flat pop).

0.description: It's Burger king people. Please! They follow the rules, try to get their orders right and try very hard to keep the bathroom clean. Some people just come in to stay warm or order from the dollar menu to be able to hang out inside. I would not be that picky. When your starving and nothing else is open, this does not seem like such a bad place at all.

4.description: You think you come to this Burger King and think you can get it your way..... bullshit! Now, I'm not a unreasonable customer, or difficult to deal with, but I take concern when it comes to a place of business where I spend my money. You could atleast give me quality customer service, which would also include hot food....that's fresh and not reserved for me before you knew I was coming. A 40ish lady who works in the drive-thru, has an awfully smelly attiitude.....(And if you my dear, happen to read this, you know who you are....and I don't give a f**k , if I knew your name, I'd sure post it on here....w/ your mugshot. You just don't know how many times you gave me the wrong sandwiches with shit on them I didn't want and in exchange trade off and give your butt a sandwich with extra knuckles.) Later for you, chick!  Mmmm hmmm..... back to my friends @ Yelp. Please, for the sake of well deserved customer service, donot, I mean never, ever ever, eat there. Too many Burger Kings in Chgo. Choose another. Luv yall!

3.description: This is quite possibly worse Mcdonalds I've ever been to. I waited about 10 mins to get served on top of that ordered oatmeal and got grits. Then the lady kept telling me they were oatmeal..

1.description: I honestly tried rating lower than a one.  I have a deep hatred for this awful place.  It has literally brought me to tears out of frustration and anger on many an occasion. Don't order anything.  There's no point, because you're lucky if you even get it within this eon.I'm starting a support group for those who have been victimized by this McDonalds.  Know that you're not alone, and that there are others who have survived (barely).

2.description: Why is English the 2nd language here? Had to wait near 5 minutes for someone to make eye contact, numerous employees walked by after my order was placed on the counter.  All I would like is to get some catsup since it's not provided opposite the service side of the counter. I eat McDonalds two, maybe three times a year, I guess I was expecting too much. Twice a year, I guess I better find a better McDonalds next time.  None of these people deserve $15 an hour  ever  on their best day....  Better off closing the store

5.description: This particular location has improved in the last year. I used to get cold food no matter what time of day I went. At least now it's warm, the service is still slow though.

0.description: If you go through the drive thru it will take forever. The dinning area is really small but it is nicer than I expected. I would rather drive to tge McDonald's on Kedzie for faster service.

4.description: What a disaster. I waited 15 minutes in the drive thru and had to leave.  Worse drive thru experience I've ever had. It's apparently always this way. Everyone on Yelp and Google rates this place as "totally sucks." How does corporate let it stay in business?

3.description: I have been a long time customer of Classic Touch, it also helps when you know the owners. I have always had issues finding someone to do my hair without damaging it and I thought I had found that with the two sisters (Alicia and Araceli) - I was WRONG. I had been going to Classic Touch for over 8 years and the sisters always did a fabulous job whether it was the cut, the style or the color. Up until recently I have not been too happy with them. I only get my hair done with the two sisters and no one else and they both should have known this detail about me for being such a repeat customer. In November 2013 I decided to go ombre - Araceli had done such a fabulous job with it! When I returned in January for a touch up, her sister, Alicia, did the touch up. After having the dye washed out of my hair, the end result was my hair being dyed a platinum blonde. I dont know how often you see platinum blonde ombre on someone's head, but that is not how I wanted it or how I had it the first time - I had a more subtle blonde. I literally was about to cry because now the color was not what I wanted, but also my hair was fried to the max! Alicia decided in order to bring down the color she needed to put some toner... end result - my hair turned silver and purple. I wanted to cry. How was I going to go to school or to my internship with purple hair. Luckily after a few washes the ends became a darker blonde. However my ends were fried to the point where I could not leave my hair down - it looked like straw. Months later I was done with the ombre and decided to go back brunette. Araceli said that I should go darker than my natural hair to get the blonde out. I thought "Okay, she'll do it and it'll look fab like all the times before". NOPE. Because she was sooo busy with another client here ASSISTANT dyed my hair. LET ME REMIND YOU THAT I NEVER LET ANYONE ELSE BESIDES THE SISTERS DO MY CUT/STYLE/OR DYE. The assistant covered my hair in black ... missing spots along the way. I did not know that my hair was not fully covered until I got home and was told. My issue was with the sisters - they did not take care of my hair the way I thought they would. I gotten my hair straightened by Alicia and she never once thought to let me know that the assistant missed parts of my hair. How unprofessional is that? I have gone through the ringer with this salon and I will never go back. It was good while it lasted, however I thought I found my "go-to" place for hair. Now to start searching again. Hope this helps anyone out there.

1.description: My family has been a long time costumers here. I decided to get my eye brows waxed a while back And the new girl who waxed my brows waxed half of my brows off. Not OK!

2.description: Love love love love loveeee this place! You'll never find another place that washes, cuts, AND styles for $25! They do an outstanding job every time and the staff is so friendly and welcoming!

5.description: Great place for a hair style and cut

6.description: I used to be a long time customer. Nearly ten years to be exact, and each and every experience with this business was pleasant until recently. I went in to add copper low lights with Angelica and the end result was fire truck red and blonde highlights!!!! I'm not a color expert, but last time I checked there was a difference between the two shades. I also pointed to the color swatch I liked and provided a picture of their previous work. When I saw the end product, I didn't know how to react. While I stared at the hot mess, Angelica convinced me that after several washes the color would fade to what I wanted. Little did I know, I'd wash my hair and the red would bleed into the blonde making me look like Carrot Top's sister. This was beyond a hot mess! I called and let them know what the situation was and Araceli, the shop manager assured me she would fix it. I went in and again the same stylist took care of me. I asked her to get rid of the red, and so she began. Turns out she just toned it down. Again, not what I asked for. Notice any patterns? Anyways, third is sorta the charm because I was fed up and just wanted it all gone. She covered it with a half effort job because now I have random patches of red, and burgundy over my natural color. As if this wasn't enough, all through out this return visit, Angelica was passive- aggressive. Smiling at me but snickering on the side, and very hard on my head, pulling and tugging at my hair as she "fixed" it. After this experience, it is needless to say that I will not be returning. They have lost several customers since many of my relatives and friends were also clients. Its a true disappointment that there is no professionalism or real responsibility with their work or to their customers. Consumers, beware of the potential wrecks you're paying for at this place.

0.description: I have known the management of Classic Touch Hair Salon, it is a happy Salon where you can go in having a couple of bad hair days and you look and feel rejuvenated!  The salon's strength is they know their happy clients for years.  The owner manager and her staff are filled with wisdom and understanding.  I have travelled for business in the USA and internationally and their is no place like having friends to build you or create a new successful you!My mother has been a happy client for many years.

4.description: Have been going here for YEARS!  The ladies at the salon do a great job.  Great cut and color at affordable prices.They do such a wonderful job with up-dos for weddings and other special occasions.  I drive out 4 to 5 times a year and it is a good 3 if not 4 hour drive round trip...but well worth journey. I would 100% recommend their services :)

3.description: Great food and service, best langostinos and mussels in Chicago! Shrimp and cheese stuffed chicken is one of my kids favorites!

1.description: This place is my second favorite seafood restruant. Their mussel appitezer is very good. I usually order the pineapple or the 7 seafood soup. The place could be bigger and staff are ok.

2.description: Great tasting food places are reasonable the service is good and it's BYOB!!! I highly recommend the cceviche! Also make sure you try the mejillones and a michelada . You can also catch some good live music in there , they are there usually Friday and Saturday nights !

9.description: DO NOT come here! I loved this place but the last couple of times I've been here I have been disappointed and today I was just plain mad with the terrible service I received. I had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated, only to get the smallest table in the entire restaurant and mind you it was four of us dining in. We were super hungry so we just let it slide, we again had to wait for our order to be taken which was again another 20 minutes or so, and this was after we waved the waitress over a couple of times. She finally took our orders and in all seriousness it took about 40 minutes for just our appetizers to come out, I don't know if it's because they are understaffed or they are just unorganized. We weren't the only table that was impatiently waiting for their food to come out. When it finally did my order was wrong, I was very upset! I will NEVER be coming back to this place!

10.description: Very disappointed!!! Food was not all that great, waitresses are not attentive and very unorganized. Our check and food took too long to get to us even though it was not really busy, never coming here again!!

4.description: The only thing missing is a bad ass salsa but who cares! Everything else here is delicious! They do it better than any other mariscos place around so be prepared to be delighted with the food. My favorite is langostinos but the stuffed pineapple was soo good! Oh and their ceviche is very fresh and yumm!!!! Its byob so drink it up and enjoy some good ol Mexican seafood.

6.description: The place has a huge menu of cocktails!  They are a BYOB establishment.  The are usually quick to serve & the staff is consistently nice.  The only reason I didn't give it full stars is that most times, because it gets ridiculously full most evenings, it is way too loud to enjoy & as a result, you wait even longer for assistance & food delivery.  Other than that, the food is great

11.description: Simply the best Mexican seafood place. The prices are cheap and the food is excellent.

5.description: Probably my favorite mariscos place. The Langostinos are super flavorful along with the camarones a la diabla and the shrimp cocktail. Overall they have Great food, good service. I definitely recommend this! It is BYOB also!!

7.description: BEST LANGOSTINOS IN CHICAGO!! Take my word for it I set out a mission to try langostinos from all Mexican seafood restaurants and this one is by far the best! Food is great, and its BYOB :)

8.description: So obsessed with this place its almost concerning.  Such good food, spacious, and a live cute little one man band on the Friday we came.  Love the stuffed pineapple and a la diabla.  Pretty much anything on the menu you'll be happy with.  Nice staff as well as fitting prices for large portions!  Always wishing I had more left overs for dayssssss!

0.description: Everybody is entitled to their own opinion but I LOOOVVVVEEEEE this place!!! My husband and I love to try different restaurants all the time but we just can't cheat on El Cangrejo with another seafood restaurant. We have always received the best service ever and the food is just too good. I love the Botana Cangrejo. I can never let that appetizer pass us up. My husband loves the Chapuzon or the Filete Relleno. Really anything you try is very tasty and extremely fresh. Even the shrimp in the shrimp cocktails are extremely good and not gummy at all.Try it out. Take your wine or beers and have a blast.

1.description: Absolutely delicious cakes! Try their chocolate mocha cake!

0.description: Luna's has the BEST tres leches cakes!  My family still makes me drive out there and get all the cakes for our parties.The prices are reasonable too!  We've been going there for years and the accept Dbt/Visa which is a plus ++++

1.description: Fresh...fresh...fresh...the turkey burgers are excellent!  I will definetly return. The only draw back is no AC.

2.description: Grandma gets it cracking in the joint always fresh and ummm ummm good

0.description: Healthful Soul Food!!! Candied Sweets, Greens with smoked turkey, Turkey meatloaf, Beef Short-Ribs, cornbread, mac 'n cheese. Wooden Spoon is a little spot on 70th and Western that pledges to make healthful affordable homemade food for the community while also respecting individual dietary restrictions. Essie is the Owner and she and her son Lloyd make their food fresh every day. Essie is a phenomenal cook! Her portions are generous and her prices are more than reasonable. She also caters for business lunches and our company has used her in the past with a great reaction from our staff with prompt and piping-hot delivery.  Her cookies and cakes rock! Breakfast is good, cheap and made-to-order with scrambles,  grits, turley patties, etc.

1.description: Food was great and service was even better.  Didn't think they would do special request but boy was i surprised.  I will be coming again and again.

0.description: Finger Food. First time here and I loved it . I'll be back for sure. Owner made our experience great. 100% authentic Mexican food.I recommend this to everyone . #IKNOWfood

1.description: Ordered online. It was fast and hot. Your norm Chinese delivery. Can't complain had huge portion and good flavor for the price.

0.description: The food was excellent. I had it delivered and the Crab Rangoon and egg rolls were hot and crisp.

3.description: I've only tried their tacos and burritos, both are very good. I like the fact that they pick a taco of the day and make it a special. There's always an available table. The place is always super clean, the staff is friendly and efficient. Food comes out fast!

1.description: First time trying this place and I can say it's was pretty good. Their fresh salsa was really good. I tried the taco which were pretty big tacos with double tortilla I gave it 2 thumbs up, tried the sope and that was a good one and also big and last but not least a cheese and salsa gordita.

2.description: I like their chicken a lot, the beans are not that good, the rice is good, I feel indifferent about the steak. Fast and good service, lovely place . the only thing I hate is that it's cash only :( .

0.description: I recently rediscovered this place.I had been here a couple of years ago when they first opened. I don't  why I stopped coming here.In my recent visits I have had many different kind of tacos. Cecina, pastor and steak. all of them are very good, big tacos so don't go crazy ordering many thinking they are small. Usual drink menu of a taqueria.The place is really clean. set up kinda like a updated diner. Bar and a few tables. They close at 9 so it is good for lunch and early dinner. The service is sporadically there. Lol sometimes you see them sometime you don't.  It doesn't bother me though.This is a good place if you are in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't make a trip from Kashaki, WI to come here. Keep an eye for the daily special. It is a good deal for something you would've gotten anyway.TLH good place P.S. If you are wondering about Kashaki, WI. It is a little town in WI where my imaginary friend Cleo is from. LOL JK

4.description: This place is very clean and the staff is very attentive.The reason it gets 3 stars and not 4 stars is i've had better steak at other places in my tacos.etc.....But their best hidden gem that people are just starting to notice is their  al pastor,which is amazing almost as good and some times better than atotonilco.And the big bonus is that they have a special taco of the week for only $1.25  usually $1.75.You just can't find good full size tacos not those slider wannabe mini tacos for under $2.00.And they have two nice tv's on each side of the place to watch.And probably the biggest thing is that they sell beer!!!!!Yea tacos and beer can't beat that.

3.description: Been a few years since I visited this place... despite being listed as "Club 6601", the sign outside calls it the Sexty Sex Lounge.  Don't let that name fool you- it's at sexty sex 01 S Western silly- nothing too dirty going on inside!It's just a friendly, mostly black neighborhood corner bar.  The decor was really something special, in about 1978!  Orange vinyl and chrome and mirrors everywhere.  I met friendly folks having a beer or two and not giving the geeky white guy and his friend a hard time at all for playing tourist at their bar.  Was a good place, with good people- and I got to pretend I was old enough to be drinking in the 70s- beat that!

1.description: Is a decent club is your in the neighborhood I would recommend going elsewhere if your looking for a younger crowd but if your looking for a typical sports bar this is the place

2.description: We were looking for an after-dinner drink with friends after a great spicy meal at Garifuna Flava Belizan restaurant around the corner on 63rd (which we also recommend), and the super nice bartender suggested this place.  The other reviewers are all right about the 70s decor -- it's in pristine condition and not to be missed.  And the curved shape of the bar, coupled with the comfortable naugahyde padded seats, removed any awkwardness in trying to have conversation among four people seated along the bar.  The bartender was extremely pleasant, informed us about upcoming events and specials.  To top it all off, Bobby Bland and Al Green on the sound system.  Can't beat it -- we'll definitely head back there, even though it's a bit of a trek for us.

0.description: Been a minute since I've been here.  The sexty sex is the plushiest bar I've ever been to.  Friendly folks at the classy feeling corner bar.  Classy cos its totally devoid of liquor posters.  Nothing but red vinyl and mirrors.  Stiff drinks and stiffer long islands, free food on sundays ('uh free soul food but sometimes it was chilly dogs?')   Recommend for a week night, don't for a friday or saturday unless you know some people from around the way cos it gets a little buck.

4.description: it's been a while since i was last here, received an invite to go on monday night, as a girl in my party said " this is sum hood shit', they are redeemed by $1.50 drinks, anything except for remy and patron. did you hear me $1.50, i had two vodka drinks with double shots for $6 and i was very nice ;). it does get crowded so get there early, i got  there around 9 by time i left there was a line outside. the barmaid told me on tuesdays they have $1.50 beer and $4 long islands on thursday. monday is the best $1.50!!!!!

1.description: My parents used to come here, now despite living a bit far off I make my drive down here for my telera and/or bolillo bread (mexican sándwich bread). Soft Conchas aré my kids favorite, the sugar toped toasty ones are my favorite conchas. My parents continue to drive down here as well, through all these years the quality has remained the same as it is a family run business. Highly recommended as I have converted quite a few family and friends and they have become Loyal customers themselves :)

2.description: This place usually has great cake. This cake today is just horrible! I'm so upset

0.description: So after a bad experience down the street with another neighborhood restaurant I was still intent on keeping my money in the neighborhood.  So for my fiance's birthday I went here.  Great choice, great cake and even better price.  Language seemed like it would have been a problem but I guess they just know what they are doing he knew exactly what i wanted and that was what reflected on the end product.  Id give them a 10 if I could.

12.description: This place is pretty damn good as far as jibaritos go! Best jibarito around town, definitely better than Sobre El Fuego which is right down the street (just east of 63rd &Kedzie). Wouldnt say better than Cafe Caribe's food in general, but very good stuff considering that it is hard to find a good PR place if any on the southside. I have gotten the chicken jibarito from here twice and it is great and it is big compared to other PR places that generally serve their sandwiches small. Their alcapurria taste very fresh and non of their plates were overally greasy. This is my go to PR spot by my house. If your thinking you want a nice sized sandwich with flavor and want a deal, choose this place you'll get full :)

7.description: I went back after getting my hair cut. I felt like having some thing warm and low and behold there was Sancocho! (especially in this cold!) I brought some to my wife and she totally enjoyed it to the max! Also, I had some pastelillos of ground meat and guava paste & cheese. They were both homemade and delicious! Don't forget to try the flan which is to die for.Weeepa!

3.description: It's true. The jibarito is a good sandwich. I'm not a big steak person, but I did enjoy the sandwich. I really liked the rice. I can eat that rice 24/7. The staff was pretty nice too. I look forward to returning. I'd like to try the potato salad and the pork chops.

1.description: This is as good as it gets for real puertorican food in the southside. I am telling you, This place is a gem! We had a jibarito with rice and gandules  and it was finger licking good! Literally! The Plantain was so fresh yet toasty. The meat was great quality.My son had the carne encebollado and he is a picky eater. He asked for seconds. The potato salad was so awesome. Tip!!! Save room for dessert!  They have regular flan and wait for it...   coconut flan. They deliver, do carry out and catering.I highly recommend this place for breakfest, lunch and dinner.They open 7 days a week and Sundays until 2pm. I promise, this has been the best Puerto Rican restarant so far if not the only one on the southside of Chicago. I did speak to the owner and it turns out he went to culinary school. So he knows how to cook food. And Puerto Rican food is not an exception.

2.description: Love this place... Great empanada's, sandwiches are great and service is fast. This is real Puerto Rican food. I always call my order ahead of time and when I walk in the door my food is always ready.

9.description: Totally a worth while place to check out if you want some PR food on the south side. First time here, had the egg and cheese breakfast sandwich and it was gr8! Cool vibe its a little whole in the wall so don't expect much in the form of scenery but the food is good!

10.description: BLT was huge and great! They make their own hot sauce and it is spectacular and very flavorful.

13.description: I had been meaning to stop in for awhile was hesitant because ive been spoiled my whole life with good PR food at home so reluctantly I stopped in and to my surprise this place is the bomb.com  . man the tripleta took me back to the island terrific & I had an alcapurria fantastic  clean & great service .place should be on Chicago's Best:) south side is on the map with this place!!!!

16.description: I'm glad I found this place. Hard to find a good Puertorican restaurant in the Southside of Chicago. This place is not just "average good", it's pretty damn good! All their sandwiches are delicious and very cheap. They only set you back around $4.00! The owner is very nice and helpful, keeps the place spanking clean. Most people go their for sandwiches but I would recommend them try their entire cuisine. The bistec encebollado (steak n onions) platter is delicious, the arroz con gandules that comes with the platter is also good, but I prefer the white rice with red beans (habichuelas guisadas). Trust me, I'm a hard critic when it comes to Puertorican food. This place, being a southside joint, is tremendously good. I stopped going to Kapeekoo (on Pulaski) because of this place, and consequently, Kapeekoo is now closed.

15.description: must say first time im eating here and im hooked... good prices, excellent food and the employees are super nice! def recommend to any one and i will be back

0.description: The food was excellent, authentic . Best jibarito sandwich and yucca alcapurrias. The rice and beans was yummy! !! Recommended.

5.description: For great Puerto Rican food at a great price this is your south side spot. Loved the jibaritos and simply made potato salad reminded me of my mommas. Service was excellent and metered street parking was in abundance. No alcapurrias for us since we were told they sell out fast but good to know for future visits.

11.description: The food is delicious, the prices are extremely reasonable and the portions were big. This was our first visit, but sure won't be our last. The Lechon was so flavorful and the Jibarito was fantastic. Let's not even mention how amazing the coconut flan is since I want to make sure they don't run out when i go back. Lol.  My boyfriend grew up with his mom's Puerto Rican food....and this ranked right up there with hers. Steve, the owner and chef was so nice. We ate dinner there and took a carry out order for the next days lunch. We will be back for sure!

8.description: I live on the southside by midway and My co-worker and I were craving jibaritos, we found this place and the food is soooo delish!!! Great service! And the coconut flan was amazing!!! Defintely going back soon!!!! Great food!

4.description: The steak jibaritos  with rice are delicious! Although the rice doesn't have olives which is what I'm used to seeing in PR rice. I've had the empanadas and they are absolutely great, not greasy at all. The coconut flan is AMAZING! I bought some today, my 4 year old daughter ate it all. Friendly staff. Not a fancy place by any means but great food. Now I don't have to travel all the way to the north side for a jibarito.

14.description: So I have been here a few times and have ordered for take out or delivery a few other. I am happy there is a place like this close to work. I have had sandwich de pernil (pork), jibarito, sides are few but very good.  The arroz puertoriqueno is very good, not too greasy without sacrificing any flavor. I also tried the empanadas de guayava, they are good. The size of the sandwiches is unbelievably huge at a really cheap price. The service is excellent. The owner/cook is really nice and helpfulThe place is very simple and clean.  This place is good for lunch or take out. Would not be good for a romantic dinner or upscale service. BTW, they have delivery, which is helpful when I don't want ot drive.The sandwich break has some real good food, better prices and helpful service.

6.description: Food was amazing,  pretty good service,  definitely will be back..... I used tolive on the north side and tried the best places,  this ranks right up there with them...

3.description: Great food went here with my mom and her boyfriend. Our server was very nice and the portion sizes are good. I would recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for Mexican food.

1.description: I've been visiting this spot for over 20 years...I usually love this Pepe's but things are changing...  The portions are getting smaller and the taste just isn't the same. I went in this weekend and ordered a Mar Y Tierra (skirt steak or grilled chicken with 4 Jumbo Butterfly Shrimp) and when I got my order I was bamboozled. There were 5 medium - large shrimp that were not butterflied. Of course they said they changed the shrimp but the menu should change too. I love shrimp and can usually tell the difference between Jumbo and regular shrimp so I was quite disappointed that I didn't get what was stated in the menu. On another note: I'm sure I will still visit this spot but not as frequently as normal. It is a good spot for drinks and to bring the kids because they let u change the TV in the back. I'm  just disappointed with the flavor going down hill.

2.description: Im sorry everything sucked

9.description: This location is awesome!  Their steak fajitas are so delicious.  They come out sizzling and in heaping amounts.  The long islands are their staple drink!  Jose is a master at making them since he's been doing it for 30 years!  In fact, the same people have worked there since I was a kid.  I will be 30 next month.  Chile con queso is bomb!  That's all I have to say about that!

10.description: I have been goint to this restaurant for the past 16 years. Wonderful food, fun staff especially Cecilio. Do not forget the best Pina colada in town.

4.description: THE WORST 'MEXICAN" food that I have EVER tasted!!!! And I LOVE Mexican food so I have tasted PLENTY!We were a party of 4..First up-A TERRIBLE Margarita with Very little alcohol...we were the ONLY customers for like 20 min so I should have known better to eat there-NEVER.TRUST.A.REST….CUSTOMERS!But,u guys know that.My hunger got the best of me that day and we were tired of looking for a place to eat.Second Boo boo-Long island iced tea made with $5 Rum..YUCK.Listen guys,Im no stranger to the bottle so I really know my liquors.and EVERY time I drink SUPER cheap rum I get sick...I got sick(later at home)..The waitress was nice,slow,but nice...There was also some random guy who seemed to work everywhere.Ceasar? O.K now on to the scary part.NO ONE liked their food.HOW do you muck up a taco? The "beef" filing was awful and it looked like chewed up food.My friend said that her steak meat for the fajita tasted like dog food.She also ordered fries that came out not cooked all the way.I had some type of combo that had a taco,tostada,COLD BEANS,Rice(EEEEEEEW) and some other garbage.I could go on and on....but I wont and you have been WARNED!(True Story)..My son is a human garbage disposal.He is tall for his age and super greedy.I brought the food home to him and the next day it was STILL in the fridge with a few bites taken off...If his greedy a$$ wont eat their food its a Wrap..SHUT IT DOWN!!!!(in my Gordan Ramsey voice lol).

6.description: I love Their Mango margaritas at this pepes !!!! & with  this heat wave I love ,,, that I have pepes a block away ,,, I love the bartender Jose he's the friendliest and happiest man ,,,, I love sitting at the bar with their nice flat screen TVs ,, there's always games on and at one point ,, I even saw the novelas :))) love it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

11.description: I hate to admit it, but I have been going to this Pepe's for over 20 years.  While I suppose that some purists could argue that the cuisine is more Tex-Mex than authentic Mexican and to a certain extent this could be true, nevertheless the food is outstanding.  I have been to a variety of Mexican restaurants and I have never found a carne asada with the juiciness and flavor of their carne asada.  Also I have enjoyed and occasionally crave their tostadas suizas.  You can have half a carne asada (and that is equivalent to about a whole carne asada at many Mexican restaurants)  along with a side item (tostada, enchilada, etc) along with rice and beans (their frijoles are absolutely perfect) for $9.25 - I would say one of the best food values in the city.  Their Margaritas are delicious and a lot of people love their Long Island iced teas (although I have not tried the latter).The service is good, the atomosphere is very pleasant.  It's hard not to love this place!They do have parking - but it is EAST of the restaurant although it appears that it would be west  (it's hard to explain but take my word for it).  Check when you park!

5.description: I have been going to this pepes for years. I have been a loyal customer. The past month I have notice a change in the customer service. I have been been treated extremely rude by the bartender "Jose". It got to the point that I needed to take a friend with me to translate to me the mean things that was being said to me by Jose in Spanish. He was calling me ugly instead of my name. Not to mention the horrible talk about my guest to his fellow co workers. The cook was using the washroom and on several time was seen using it and not washing her hands after exiting the washroom. This was very disgusting.  I'm glad I had my friend translate everything. I will never go back to this restaurant again and I plan on contacting their boss to complain.

8.description: I say definitely go to this place for the steak & chicken mariachis (shish kabobs) and the long island iced tea. F.Y.I. the long islands are actual drinks not just that pre-made mix stuff. definitely the drink to get you where you wanna go ;)Sure it's definitely not authenic mexican cuisine... but the booze makes up for that =P

0.description: This is not like any other Pepe's I have been to - and I tried MANY hoping for a place like this.  I couldn't find one, so this is it.  People that used to live around here on the southwest side still find their way to the bar on some evenings from as far away as Mokena.  You always come back here.  The food quality and service - and the drinks made by Jose at the bar are what you go here for.  It's a comfortable place where you want to hang out and have a few drinks and chat it up with friends or make new ones.I've been going here since 1992, and it has remained consistent.  Jose IS this Pepe's as far as I'm concerned, it wouldn't be the same without him!  People at the bar tell me stories of how they've been coming since the 80's and it has remained consistent (other than price inflation).Food recommendations:  Steak, chicken, pork, chorizo tacos, chicken mariachis, any quesadillas, any fajitas, carne asada dinners.... just about everything.   Ask for the "macho sauce" if the amazing table salsa doesn't burn you and you want to feel some heat.Drinks:  LONG ISLAND ICED TEA is what they have been known for since Jose touched a bottle of tequila.  This is the signature drink of this place, ask anyone sitting at the bar and they will tell you the same.  Margaritas second (on the rocks), and a good selection of top shelf tequila (you can request that your drink be made with Don Julio or Tres Generations etc for an extra charge).  People come here to hang out at the bar, talk, drink, eat and watch TV/sports.  There are two TVs at the bar, always great conversation - and if no one is there, Jose will keep you good company!  A cold can of Modelo with lime in a frosty mug is great too, as they have a full selection of Mexican beers.Summary:  This is no ordinary Pepe's.  Take what you know about Pepe's food, service and atmosphere of other locations and walk into this one as if it were another restaurant.  Sit at the bar, order a long island, get the macho sauce for your chips.  It'll be a GREAT night!   Friday and Saturday nights are the best nights to go hang out.  The neighborhood can be a little "iffy" at night, but you will be fine inside the restaurant and the police station is right down the street.  Just hide your valuables before you park your car here just in case!  It's WORTH IT!

1.description: This is the real deal!!!I found this place on a magazine ad dining at a restaurant. I am always up for checking new places so had to check it out.I was there with a friend Tuesday around 7 PM. We park right in front and and go inside. The restaurant is typical of many Mexican seafood restaurants with plastic sharks, trees and a hammock right in the middle high on the ceiling. We sit and the waitress comes with the menus, some ceviche, tostadas, crackers and habanero salsa. We ordered carne Zamora, piña rellena and langostinos, jarrito de mandarina and we are cool. I did not know that it is BYOB, I would've brought some coronas or tequila. Oh yea is BYOB.My friend gets a tostada, puts some ceviche and stats spooning habanero salsa like is ketchup. I tell him "hey dude try it first, it might be hot". "I'll be ok" he replied. Lol needless to say he wasn't. Lets put it this way I saw a couple of tears on his face LOL. Now I have something to bash him with for months. Point being that habanero salsa is extremely hot, beware.After my laughing about my friend trying to get rid of the burn, we get  the food. Everything was delicious. The carne Zamora comes with a good size skirt steak, cooked to perfection, a quesadilla, Mexican chorizo, whole beans, rice, grilled green onions and jalapeño. Truly delicious combination. The langostinos are good, well seasoned (not too salty or over seasoned) fresh good quality prawns.But then, the piña rellena (stuffed pineapple) ....  Can't find the proper term to describe it without sounding like a teenager (erase: OMG, heavenly, seriously) f*^ing perfect. The perfect combination of flavors. Half pineapple, scooped out the flesh, grilled shrimp, octopus, fish cheese and broiled. You get the sweetness of the pineapple combined with the seafood and then a little bit of heat from the hot peppers and to top it off some melted cheese. This was some serious good eating. This comes with rice, salad, garlic bread and fries.After eating all that food I wished there was more pina rellena, not because I was still hungry, or the portion (portions are huge) but because that is one of those addicting flavors that you can't stop eating (or at least I).  Yeap it was that good.Can't wait to come back on a week end. I think they have music or karaoke. At least that is what the waitress told me, service is super nice and attentive. They checked on us a few times throughout the dinner. When we got the check I was surprised the prices are reasonable here. CASH only, LOL I learned that the hard way.MMLB,  great food, reasonable prices, good service, cash only and BYOB

2.description: This place has really good food. It is spacious & the also have carne Asada for those who don't eat seafood. If I recall correctly it's BYOB, the food is delicious & it's usually never too packed. Good customer service as well.

0.description: This is my ultimate seafood place!!!  This place is by far thee best environment to have a great time at. The quality & portions of the food cannot be compared to other local seafood places. The waitress are amazing! Don Jose the chef is a great cook, and does a beautiful job! I had my baby shower in the side hall they have... That's how much I LOVE this place! Anyone who is looking for a great seafood place without over paying for their dinner, this is the place to be! And BYOB!!! Besides the fact that they also have alternative options for non sea food eaters!

58.description: Excellent service but the prices are getting higher... probably because they have more and more groupon traffic.

56.description: Oysters ok. Food over priced. Service not willing to please when complained.

29.description: Nice!  Very attentive and helpful staff plus delicious food made this visit memorable and relaxing

42.description: I had a groupon and the restaurant is located In a more quiet part of the south loop. The clam chowder was thick and chunky ( $6-$9) for soup that taste like can soup. My friend ordered the chef selection of nigiri. It didn't look too fresh and dry In color. I was told that it's not too fresh. I give 2 stars because the oysters are very fresh . I would definitely go back for the oyster happy hour in the bar area, but not for dinner. Service was attentive.

23.description: (This review is 6 months late.. I know.. Sue me!)My friend and I decided to try this spot as a potential place to have her birthday dinner. Walking in from the cold was a nice visual treat. The fireplace was on with low lighting giving off a very cozy ambience. We sat by the window and studied the menu. Our strategy was to order things our boyfriends would enjoy as well. Take leftovers home. Everything really seemed great so we ordered1) COH grilled Oysters. They were ok. 2) Rockefeller Oyster. These were very good. 3) Southern Fried Oysters. These were ok. 4)Soft Shell Crab. Skip these5) Sake Mussels. Hot damn those were excellent! Mussels cleaned very well with a really tasty broth. 6) Lamb Chops. So good!7) Wasabi Mashed Potatoes. Very good... Different but very good. 8) Salmon Teriyaki. Very good and fresh! All in all it was a good night out. Most of the menu items were very good some not so much. Our waitress was super friendly too.

47.description: This is a good place for a snack and nothing more.  It's way too expensive for the actual amount of food you get.  Sure, the taste is great but at what cost?  Even the drinks were overpriced.  The waitstaff were friendly and helpful.  I just think they could have added a few more economical choices on their menu which they pretty much didn't have any.  And forget about parking.  It's a pain in that whole area.  Go for a small bite but don't go if you are starving.

8.description: went here last week with my girl and the food was delicious!! we tried the restaurant week menu along with other items off their regular menu. we had raw oysters from both west and east coast, oyster shooters, lobster dinner with veggies and cheesecake for dessert. everything was soooooooo tasty! our server was super nice and she recommended which oysters would be a better choice for what we liked since they have so many types of oysters to choose from. the setting is fancy with dim lights so its kinda romantic, ooooh la la! we love seafood & could eat it every day so this place fixes that craving!

31.description: My boyfriend and I decided to go here for a casual Friday date night since we had a groupon. We, however, did spend a little more than we intended to but $160 later, the food and service were worth every penny. Grilled oysters was delicious and surf n turf sushi roll was the best my boyfriend ever had. He never had oysters before until then and he was hooked. The waitress was friendly and helpful. We would definitely go back. Hopefully they will bring back more groupon. Who wouldn't love a good deal!

34.description: Went for the Oyster Bar happy hour stayed for dinner. The food was great! The service was exceptional! 1st star deducted b/c the power went out when we were there. Possibly nothing to do with the restaurant itself but no one thought to apologize? As if it was normal for patrons to eat their dinner in complete utter darkness. We were offered a candle after a few minutes but we still ended up using our cell phone flashlights to be able to finish up &  light clear paths.2nd star deducted b/c in trying to gather our belongings at the end of the night I bumped into the table & knocked my Red Bull to the floor. It busted open, so I asked the young lady at the front could it be replaced? She started to say something & from the tone she took I could tell she didn't want to replace it. I paid $5 per can & spent 127.** on dinner! It was pitch black in the restaurant due to the power outage & you have an issue with replacing the can? Wow!Not sure if I would go back just yet. It doesn't seem to be customer friendly

16.description: We are all on the new Weight Watchers points plus plan (with the exception of my niece) and the food options and quality were outstanding.  The service was great and the Red King Crab legs were a hit with everyone.  The assorted oysters on the half shell were fresh and the variety terrific.  I live on the east coast but the variety was unmatched by any in my recent Maryland experience.

13.description: I think this has to be my new favorite place. Made a reservation during happy hour and enjoyed sampling all of the oysters for 1.75 or 1.50 each. Can't remember because I'm too delirious with my food coma lol. Also had the grilled oysters and every kind was amazing! Drinks were ok but pretty weak. Overall I will be back. Oh the miso soup is a must and pretty authentic to what my sister had while living in Japan!

11.description: All around great experience.  The service was great (Thanks Alyssa!) and the food was perfect.  The oyster selection is better than other places in the city (I will not name names) and we look forward to making it to Oyster Bar Happy Hour.  I think we were both surprised by the sushi selection.  In addition to a dozen oysters, my wife and I shared the "Rockin Roll."  Just great all around.  Looking forward to another visit and adding that 5th star.  (Typically, I reserve the 5th for a place that is consistent.)

39.description: Fell back in love with oysters and seafood! Came here on a whim and keep coming back. The blue point oyster special Monday is almost as good as the snowcrab special on Tuesday!!

37.description: The Chicago Oyster House is the best in town! Fresh! Fresh! Fresh! The culinary ideas and the artistic take on food is amazing! And the Oyster shot is out of this world! I highly recommend this place!

0.description: I'm pretty happy with their oyster happy hour. $1.50/oyster from a list of 6 or so options. The 2 west coast varieties were very fresh and tasty - no kumamotos :(. I highly recommend the oyster shooter. A tad too much ponzu sauce but the overall taste was fantastic.Our server mentioned that they're known for their grilled oysters so we tried that, too. You get three oysters in different preparations - ginger and scallion, "firecracker" with basil, and parmesan (aka COH). The COH was a bit bland but the other two were spot on. I see rave reviews for the COH so maybe I'll give it another shot...The clam chowder was really good. Not the best I've ever had but pretty up there and definitely satisfying on a winter night. The grilled lobster was tougher than I expected but this was my first time trying lobster grilled. Maybe this is the texture you should get when you grill a lobster? If so, I'm not a fan.I ordered off of the prix fixe Chicago Restaurant Week menu so I was forced to get a dessert. I preferred the cheesecake over the key lime pie but my girlfriends were happier with the key lime pie.Service was friendly and attentive. Pacing in the kitchen was off once the tables filled up but tolerable with drinks and good company. All in all though, I'd come back again to focus on their oyster offerings.

38.description: Thanks GrubHub!!!! My boyfriend and I ordered our Valentines' Day dinner here and the food was amazing, well, mine was, at least. He ordered the snow crab legs and they were a little salty for his liking. I had the Oyster Rockefeller and the Sake Mussels. All of MY food was great, I would come back, as for my boyfriend, the juror is still out.

51.description: The menu is a bit pricey however my overall dining experience was worth the cost.  I enjoyed the seafood boil, crab cakes, fried oysters and a variety of sushi rolls. The food was fresh and the atmosphere was cozy. Our waitress was efficient but we couldn't help  feeling rushed at times which was a huge turn-off.

27.description: Yet again. nothing but sh*t here

32.description: Simply amazing... ask for becky... she knows her oysters.... personally loved the naked cowboy oysters.  You have to try the oyster shooter.

54.description: Went here the other night for dinner. Let's just say 18 dollars for chicken teriyaki that was hard and dry then the the sushi was just as miserable. I suggest the beer and oysters. The service was pretty bad considering there were more employees then people in the restaurant we watched our sushi sit at the bar for about 10 mins before the waitress got it she might have been new but I was shocked that none of the other employees got the food so it didn't sit there. This might explain where the entrees were so bad.... I use to love this place but now I don't think I will return.

48.description: Arrived in time for oyster happy hour and could not have been more pleased with the selection and the price. The service was excellent. Our server was very attentive and the advice she offered was spot on. We sampled a number of appetizers. The clam chowder and the crab cakes were my favorites.  It was our first time there but we will DEFINITELY be back.  As for those who wrote it was too pricey, I thought it was in line considering the quality and freshness of the food.

44.description: Food is definitely forgettable.  Could have made it at home.  Fried oyster sauce is a mix of ketchup and hot sauce.  Chowder is a premade canned clam chowder liquid, with ity bity potatoes and they put three clams on top.  Flavor was Campbell's soup basic. Scallops were, again, basic.  Sauteed in butter and garlic, tasty, but I could've made it myself.  They rehydrated some beef jerky and wrapped it around asparagus and topped it with a bottled brown sauce of some sort, I'm just saying, the sauce tasted cheap. For lack of a better word.  Nothing was authentic or freshly made.  Shrimp tempura was the same type as the one sold in the freezer section at the grocery store.  Crab was boiled in salt water, very salty.  Rockerfellas (don't know how to spell it) were bland.  Lobster claws....... Basic.....  I could go on and on, ordered most of the menu.  Not nasty, but All basic, lack luster, unauthentic, all freezer section food.  Ambiance was great. Service was great.  Won't go again.

24.description: Oyster not bad, and at the reasonable price if you go to there during happy hour. The owner probably is a Asian, and they have some Japanese style cuisine

7.description: I've always come to COH on days where it's not super busy I.e weekday evening around 5pm or Sunday. Every time I've come the service has always been prompt. The atmosphere is a mixture of high end and casual. I love the location too. I live in northwest Indiana so coming to south loop is easy for me, I get the "downtown" feel without any of the tourists. My fiancé and I loved the oysters, sushi, and clam chowder. It was a little expensive but the service was great and our server was knowledgeable about the food. I will come back!

49.description: Don't even try their ceviche. Not good. Too much condiment/chives that lost the flavor of seafood. Had to chew gums right after. Ordered another two grilled oyster after the first set; but second set were RAW/barely cooked compared to the first set of grilled ones. Rec Oyster shot.

40.description: LOVE IT...LOVE IT!!! Always recommended!!! Great deals through groupon. Husband and I frequent this place for their large selection of fresh oysters from east coast and west coast which is rare in Chicago especially for the price. Monday $1.50 blue point all day!! Other "must have" are their shrimp tempura, oyster shooter, fried calamari, and many of their maki. This place is definitely a hidden gem.

53.description: Over priced half legs kingcrab for 20$ just half legs ?are you kidding me ? You can pay about 25$ more for all you can eat kingcrab at glen s diner but for this place you just got one.

30.description: Great oyster selection (for Chicago). Fantastic happy hour (everyday). 15% of wine bottles on Sunday. The end.

46.description: Really good food, but be prepared to spend more.It's all worth it though!!!

1.description: Come to this restaurant only for the oysters and California Rolls. They were really good. The entrées were not that good or should I say that it wasn't hot when they served it. I ordered the teriyaki salmon. It appeared to be grilled but was drowned in that teriyaki sauce... My sister had the grilled prawns and her entree wasn't hot either... I really enjoyed tasting all the oysters and nothing else.

55.description: I live a few blocks away from this restaurant and I really enjoy coming here for their oysters and sushi. The servers are friendly and everything we ordered were delicious. I never had a bad meal here. I love this place!

9.description: I order the seafood pasta it was flavorless and the pasta was over cooked     I also had the angry crab roll it was drenched in sesame oil. I informed the server she didn't even respond.

26.description: Obviously a seafood specialty restaurant with sushi influence. Good portion sizes and high quality and variety. Many ways to be added appetizer overload.

25.description: All around great experience.  The service was great (Thanks Alyssa!) and the food was perfect.  The oyster selection is better than other places in the city (I will not name names) and we look forward to making it to Oyster Bar Happy Hour.  I think we were both surprised by the sushi selection.  In addition to a dozen oysters, my wife and I shared the "Rockin Roll."  Just great all around.  Looking forward to another visit and adding that 5th star.  (Typically, I reserve the 5th for a place that is consistent.)

12.description: Best casual seafood restaurant in Chicago! A+++ service and food. Highly recommend the ceviche! I don't usually like raw shellfish but it is always fresh and never fishy. Can't comment on desserts but if you're still hungry after soup, salad, ceviche, and sushi you didn't do it right.

59.description: Really enjoy having this place in the area.  We LOVE oysters and they have oyster happy hours too.  On our last visit, we attended for the evening crab leg special.  The crab was very much over salted, so I'd avoid that -- in fact, I'd avoid just about everything on the menu, with the exception of the oysters -- which were fantastic.  1) go here only if you're an oyster lover 2) when you order, make sure you ask for the best options that are freshest that day.  p.s. They have a nice Cava for the price.
