21.description: I ordered seaweed salad, fish tacos, and Chicago maki rolls.  The seaweed salad was VERY salty and the portion was really big.  They really should have small and large for the seaweed salad.  The fish tacos were okay, nothing special.  The Chicago maki rolls were good (but not amazing).  Maybe their other dishes are better, but I don't think I'll come back again.

17.description: This place is awesome, great oysters, seafood, and steak. The surf and turf steak and lobster at $50 is great. Its like a sushi joint that does other things great.Try th COH oysters, OMG they are great5 stars cause thats only as few as i can give  10 stars is more like it.

10.description: (This review is 6 months late.. I know.. Sue me!)My friend and I decided to try this spot as a potential place to have her birthday dinner. Walking in from the cold was a nice visual treat. The fireplace was on with low lighting giving off a very cozy ambience. We sat by the window and studied the menu. Our strategy was to order things our boyfriends would enjoy as well. Take leftovers home. Everything really seemed great so we ordered1) COH grilled Oysters. They were ok. 2) Rockefeller Oyster. These were very good. 3) Southern Fried Oysters. These were ok. 4)Soft Shell Crab. Skip these5) Sake Mussels. Hot damn those were excellent! Mussels cleaned very well with a really tasty broth. 6) Lamb Chops. So good!7) Wasabi Mashed Potatoes. Very good... Different but very good. 8) Salmon Teriyaki. Very good and fresh! All in all it was a good night out. Most of the menu items were very good some not so much. Our waitress was super friendly too.

5.description: The mixture of east coast seafood and Japanese culinary is very conflicting. The food is just mediocre and for the price, not sure it's worth it. The tables are inches apart from each other, didn't enjoy being on a date with several other couples. I wouldn't say it was terrible but I won't be back.

3.description: In a word "awesome" -all around! Food was magnificent,service excellent, great wine list, ambiance perfect! My wife and I enjoyed an excellent and memorable evening! We shook the owners hand on the way out and let him know he and his staff are doing it right!

35.description: Highly recommended. Really great sushi and a nice friendly place to go.Try the Maki and their take on ceviche.

19.description: Oyster not bad, and at the reasonable price if you go to there during happy hour. The owner probably is a Asian, and they have some Japanese style cuisine

28.description: A friend and I decided we wanted some oysters and sushi. They have a large selection and their description of each one was spot on. We ate 2 dozen and had 3 rolls. I loved everything we had. Service was great and I can't wait to get back.

45.description: FABULOUS! I ordered delivery on a Friday night and it only took about 30 minutes to arrive at my door. The seafood miso soup came piping hot and flavorful. ( everything was wrapped in plastic to seal it's freshness ) the edamame was spot-on and the oysters... mmmmm delicious! Thank you so much! Even the delivery driver was super polite! Can't wait to become a regular and try more of your delicious menu.

33.description: Chicago Oyster House used to be Triad and they carried on and improved up what was a great menu with new offerings, service and a completely remodeled interior. This is a place where you feel equally comfortable being a first date, your boss to butter them up for a promotion, your college roommate who you haven't seen for 10 years...or ideally they're all one and the same. The menu carries on the excellent sushi from the prior concept and expanded with an oyster selection to travel across the city for. Can't say enough about the new owners attention to detail on everything.

43.description: This place is great. Half the place is a bar; the other half is a sit-down restaurant. Due to location, the bar is never crowded. I like it that way though. It's easier to talk to people. The atmosphere is casual and the waitresses are very pleasant.Their oysters are very fresh and they have a healthy variety. In regards to pricing, it's average. Some might consider the price high, but if you want FRESH then it's worth the price. It's the Midwest, so it won't get any better than this place.

2.description: Came here last Sat (1/23 ) to have dinner with my college friend from ATL to celebrate her bday and restaurant week. We chose to partake the oyster happy hour and sushi vs the Restaurant Week menu and we were not disappointed. The oysters were fresh and clean. My favorite was the Naked Cowboy. Re: we had the Rainbow, Chicago, Tuna Supreme and Winter Makis, which were all good. Will be back to indulge in the oyster offerings

18.description: This place is great. Half the place is a bar; the other half is a sit-down restaurant. Due to location, the bar is never crowded. I like it that way though. It's easier to talk to people. The atmosphere is casual and the waitresses are very pleasant.Their oysters are very fresh and they have a healthy variety. In regards to pricing, it's average. Some might consider the price high, but if you want FRESH then it's worth the price. It's the Midwest, so it won't get any better than this place.

41.description: Very nice cozy addition to the South Loop. The C.O.H grilled oyster topped with garlic, cilantro and parmesan cheese is fantastic! Very good sushi selections.

52.description: oyster are fresh, they have different oyster from different area and different taste. I ate 3 dozen of them, cost me more than 100~

50.description: The sushi great the fried soft shell crab not so good....not sure if its worth another trip...my hubby didn't like his shrimp tempeura too either.

4.description: Came to Chicago Oyster House on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and we enjoyed ourselves . We ordered a Margarita and a Cosmo to start and the waitress explained they had a big party which would slow down our food to come . The restaurant wasn't packed at all but okkkk. We never had sushi so waitress gave us many suggestions and we ended up getting the Volcano sushi rolls and they were delicious . For dinner I ordered the Salmon Teriyaki Entree and my Boyfriend ordered the Cajun Seafood Boil. We both enjoyed our dinner and would definitely come back   !!

6.description: The stars are for the wonderful service of the staff and the variety of oysters they offer. Had such high hopes for this place. The Living Social voucher I purchased was a waste of money. Their happy hour specials were a much better deal. I tried all 10 oyster varieties that they offer. There were three I didn't care for: The Conway Cup was too briny, Capital City had an oily aftertaste, and Hama Hama was too chewy (for the novice - you're not supposed to chew them, you slurp). For my main entrée I had the Alaskan Red King Crab legs and my dinner companion had the Tuna Supreme. Neither one was all that fresh nor did it hit the mark. I have to say I appreciated the sugar scrub in the women's washroom, pulls double duty - it helps to combat winter dryness and masks the crab legs smell. Sadly, this may be the one and only time we come here. My companion feels this place has too many strikes against it: lack of parking, the Living Social voucher blunder, and the stale sushi and crab legs.

22.description: Run don't walk to this place. The food was exceptional a great date night place. Taylor our server was fantastic. We mix and matched a dozen fresh oysters had the crab cakes and the asparagus beef roll. Oh and cheesecake for dessert.  The chef's work was outstanding. A hidden gem don't be afraid to leave the loop it's just short jaunt. Yum

15.description: Came to Chicago Oyster House last Saturday for restaurant week so we choose to order from the prix fixe menu $44 and it was a 4 course meal so worth it!! I had raw oysters there were so good.   Second course I choose the fish tacos and very flavorful.  3rd course I had seafood pasta there was shrimp, mussels ,clams and calamari in a red sauce that was very spicy  that's   just the way I like it. and dessert I ordered the key lime pie it was perfect.  I almost forgot we had drinks  which is not part of the prix fixe menu.  I had a margarita I asked for partron instead of the jose cuervo that was on the menu.  overall we  will be going back.   parking is a bit of a challenge .

57.description: Prices too high for the food and service.  The appetizer was barely enough for one person,  not two.  I had a sushi roll and my date had the shrimp tempura.  Presentation counts and it was disappointing along with the taste.  Maybe we should have had only oysters.  We had to remind our server 4 times that we requested water then no one refilled our water glasses.  I could understand if busy night but there were only three other tables occupied besides ours last night.

20.description: I dont know about their other menus but I wanted to eat raw oysters so bad that I came here by myself for their Happy Hour (which exists even on Sunday apparently). Consumed 16 oysters and an oyster shooyer in the blink of an eye and am very satisfied. Beer selection was good too. Maybe their other menus are on a bit pricey side but their happy hours are awesome

36.description: Ordered via the Grub Hub app:New England clam chowder  - Very small portion - Soup tasty but lacking contents like potatoes and clams - No crackers - $11Southern Fried oysters - 6 oysters - Oysters were soft and tasty but nothing special  - Dipping sauce an unmemorable afterthought - $15 Total with tax and delivery: $34.72Grub Hub told me my order would be delivered by 7:36pm. I finished my dinner at 6:45pm.  Nothing special. Not worth another order from Chicago Oyster House.

14.description: I must say that this place had some of the most delicious oysters I've ever had. My sister and I must have come at a time where they had just opened. The place was pretty quiet and very cozy. We sat on the side with the bar. We came during their happy hour specials and it was well worth it. I even enjoyed the homemade sugar scrub hand wash that they have in the bathroom. I would definitely come back.

1.description: better than anything you ever tasted

0.description: The chicken wings here are hands down the best chicken wings ever. Not too greasy, meat super tender. Plus! You get thirty wings and a butt load of fries for 20 bucks?! Dude, total hidden gem!
Pretty good. They have burgers stuffed with cheese. Probably bad for you, but taste Great !!!!

58.description: Wow! My taste buds did not expect this most pleasant surprise! Jerk chicken is off the chain, Belizean chicken stew is tasty, guacamole had a perfect consistency and very flavorful (especially with the plantain chips), and the rice with gravy was scrumptious.. Will definitely be back for seconds, maybe later today

56.description: #TripleDIt's the flava that you savor!  The positive yelp reviews don't lie.  The food at Garifuna Flava is AWESOME!So many choices and very affordable for the amount of food you get. I ended up getting the Jerk Chicken, Panades, and washed it down with some kind of "Breeze" drink.  The Jerk Chicken is not like Jamaican Jerk.  This is food from Belize.  So, it's not as spicy.  One order is about half a chicken...so, I couldn't finish it.  The chicken has this smokiness with each bite that makes your mouth water for another bite.  I would recommend ordering this chicken with a friend or two and then getting some other dishes.  The sauces were awesome too!   The panades were excellent as well.  The fish inside was very delicious while the deep fried outside shell wasn't drenched in oil.  Habanero slaw (& the mild) were EXCELLENT!  I could put that stuff on hotdogs, hamburgers, tacos, sushi, cake...Every around me was ordering the Conch soup that looked so good.   That may be the better way to go if you're with a smaller party.  I also appreciated my waiter giving me a "BELIZE" tourist guide, just in case, I wanted to visit the country of Belize.  That was another first for me.    This is #56 on my quest to eat at all the Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives in America!

29.description: i've had more than my fair share of jerk chicken and beans and rice, both here and in kingston, negril and montego bay.  but i'm telling you, this is the best freaking jerk chicken i've ever had.  the end.  and the beans and rice, about which i was super wary...uh-mazing!  they were at groupon today and i hope and pray they'll come back early and often 'cause i'd beg like james brown to get more. i'm spoiled and done with the others, whoever they are..

42.description: Took the trek over to Garifuna Flava on a Friday night with some friends. We had previously made reservations but we were only one out of three groups here. I agree with most of the other reviews, order all the appetizers! They are all great and really cheaply priced. The guacamole wasn't great, but the conch fritters and panades made up for it. The entrees were good as well but I'm pretty sure we could've just ordered the rice and beans and been satisfied. We had the stewed beef, shrimp, and conch soup. We ordered some of the signature cocktails and even being Caribbean styled, they were tasty and not too sweet. Our waiter was friendly enough but wasn't super knowledgable about the menu and couldn't answer some of our questions about the menu. Overall, it's a great place to stop if your in the neighborhood.

23.description: Best around in the south side. Glad we have a local spot. There servings are pretty generous for the price and there sauce on the side is amazing.

47.description: So we ordered a variety of menu items from conch fritters and panadas, to king fish and Carmel cake. Everything was completely delicious, but the star of the night was the sweet potato cake!  This cake will make you speechless! By far the highlight of my meal.

8.description: They came to my job today, and after reading such great reviews, i was eager to try it. I had the following:Stew Chicken: I really loved the stew chicken. Extremely flavorful and the meat would fall right off of the bone. Will definitely be my 'go to' dish when i visit their actual restaurant. I've never liked stew chicken from other restaurants i've tried, but they hit it right on the nail with how they prepare it.Jerk Chicken: It wasn't bad, but i've had better in Chicago. As mentioned in a previous review, the jerk chicken isn't spicy at all and almost tasted like normal bbq chicken...but what made me like it, is when i dipped the chicken in the side of green sauce they give you. Once i did that, then the jerk chicken had a chance. Rice and Beans: Extremely good, great texture, and especially loved the gravy that they pour on top of it. Was the best rice and beans i've ever had. Would definitely order this again.  Cabbage: The cabbage was good, it had a hint of spiciness to it which i loved about it. No complaints here and would order this side again.Overall the food was great. I almost feel like i was charged a premium for the fact they were bringing the food to my company vs. me picking the food up at their actual restaurant. Paid $25 for all of the food above, and each were in very small containers. Hope when i visit the restaurant the portions are a bit bigger for the cost, but overall good! It was great to see a restaurant thats located on the south side of chicago, come downtown to participate in the FOODA program. Keep up the hard work!

31.description: Totally awesome food!!!! I had the Chicken Jerk. The chemistry with the Jerk Sauce and the seasoning on the chicken... oh. my. god!! Amazing :) I thoroughly enjoy the beans and rice too, especially with the gravy it came with! Nom nom nom :) Would definitely go back and recommend it to others!

34.description: Overall, the food here is great. I was very skeptical to eat here because I'm not familiar with one belizean restaurant that has jerk chicken but no fry jack and no bun on the menu. I was able to completely ignore my rude date by stuffing my mouth with food. The panades is excellent!!!! The masa was perfect, well seasoned, and the fish was perfect. Now, I'm used to the big long panades my family makes but these little bite sized ones were so good and packed with flavor. The garnaches was made different than how we make it home but it was good. I just had to add more onion sauce, which was fresh and not watered down. I'm biased when it comes to tamales because I like the cull seasoned a certain way but the tamales here is well worth the try. Our server was pleasant, even though my date was totally rude, he was very accomodating and quick. The atmosphere is casual, they played a mix of soca, punta, and reggae music.The tv is where everyone can see it from the tables and bar. They also have Grace fruit juice! I wish they were located in a more central part of the city but its worth the trip.

16.description: I've been dying to try this place..I figured today was a good day, because I came into the city to see the STANLEY CUP! !Ok.. so they were 7 minutes late in opening. The front window is cracked,  with some old, nasty tape holding it together. .They really should fix it, for curb appeal. .I ordered the panadas, which are served with a mild & a spicy cabbage sauce. They were good... don't know if I'd order them again.I had the BEEF STEW lunch special. ..with rice & beans, and  the Belize potato salad. .Two chunks of meat in a bowl??! And ...I think a.. plantain on the plate...which was old & cold tasting.The beef was fantastic. .as was the rice n beans..All of a sudden the music was all bass, and  hurting my ears!! It was vibrating in my chest...It was making it hard to enjoy my meal..

13.description: I went with my regular brunch crew and I must say we were not disappointed.We saw the place on DDV and got to meet the owner. Really cool guy.We basically ordered every appetizer and they were all delicious. My favorite was the chicken tamale. It took a little long to get everything, but we could tell it was all made with love by the owner's mom! (Yes his mom is the chef!!!!)

11.description: Garifuna Flava has pretty good food and I'm glad it is in the location that it is in. Growing up in Englewood, I was always disappointed in the lack of food options. How many times can one eat from the same Chinese restaurant, really? I still have family in the area, so today on a visit I decided to try out this restaurant.      There were two other people ordering with me and we placed a pretty large carry out order. We were told 20 minutes, and when we arrived it was all ready to go. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, conch soup, plantain chips and guacamole, and the Jamaican jerk and Belizean stew chicken lunch specials. I was so surprised when the total was less than 45 bucks!      Now onto the food: the panades had a good flavor, but I would have preferred a bit more filling. The plantain chips and guacamole were delicious and the portion size was great. The conch fritters were huge and were so delicious-definitely my favorite out of what we tried. They could have been a tad less greasy, though. The side conch soup was actually huge and full of veggies and seafood.      The lunch specials came with some side choices and we chose rice and beans, garden salad, potato salad, and stewed cabbage so we could try it all. The chicken in both lunch specials was flavorful and not dry. The jerk sauce was good too. Out of our sides, the cabbage was definitely the best. My husband enjoyed the potato salad, but he was literally given a tablespoon's worth. That was truly the only bummer out of our experience.      If you're in the area, definitely try this place out. I also read that there will be a buffet and drink specials for the upcoming Mayweather-Pacquiao fight so it might be a good time to dine in!

39.description: Very delicious food. I had the chicken stew. Wish they gave more plantains but still good. Bringing my hubby back here. And they have wifi

37.description: Don't know much about Belizean food for comparisons but the food here tastes good to me! Like the conch fritters and the stew beef is melt in your mouth good!

0.description: At the office building where I work, we have a pop up restaurant that is occupied by a different restaurant every day. Well I hope Garifuna will be here every week.It is such a challenge to find real Jamaican and Carribean food in the northern part of the country. These guys came over and served jerk chicken, stewed chicken, plantain chips, and other local favorites. I went with three small pieces of jerk chicken along with rice and black beans, and a fried plantain for $9.00. The chicken was moist and juicy and well seasoned, though it could have used a little extra heat in the seasoning. Then I added some of their jerk salsa onto both the chicken and rice and beans. That is what took this meal over the top. The salsa had some burn, but was still manageable. It added punch, without overpowering the chicken or rice. The rice and beans also had nice texture as well.I don't know if I would head down to their locaton, but I can testify these guys know how to make some good jerk chicken. Load up on that salsa!

38.description: Soooooo I plan on going to the actual restaurant location very very soon. For those that work downtown definitely take advantage of Nosh Market at Block 37 (extended through March). I stumbled upon Garifuna and ordered the jerk chicken plate (jerk chicken, red rice and beans, and plantains) Every item was delicious. The jerk chicken was flavorful and whatever green sauce that was on the side was good! I like the red rice and beans had a spicy kick to them. The plantains were sweet and not overdone. I cannot wait to bring my mom to the actual location. That caramel pound cake is calling my name!

51.description: I used to come on here and blast them for poor service, but I stand forever corrected.  I don't care if I wait two hours this food is worth the wait.  My mainstay is the white meat jerk chicken dinner.  I've come here about 5 times in a row and if nothing else this food is consistently delicious.  For the sides I have cabbage which is sweet a little sour.  My other sides were beans, rice and plantains.  All were skillfully prepared. On a whim I tried the panades.  Fun fact = I abhor fish.  The panades were magnificent crispy fried with yummy sauce and sadly they didn't make it home. I would highly recommend this place.  Yes, service is slow, but it is family run with a whole lotta love.  The staff is friendly, so be patient and kind.  Lastly,  please try the Belizean Long Island, it will make your night magical.

27.description: Maybe daughter and I went to Garifuna Flava for the first time on Sunday of this week, the food was the very best I've had in a long time everything was seasoned just right and to find a place like this in the hood, this is a gem. And to find out it's bend here for 7 years I was shocked.  Everyone need to go out and try Garifuna Flava it' s great

32.description: Jerk chicken - Full of flavor and spice. Not overly hot as some jerk tends to be.Beans and rice - Great on its own, even better with the gravy that comes with it.Panades - Little pieces of happiness. A MUST have.King Fish w/ creole sauce - Yummy! Has a nice balance of sweet and hot.Jamaica cream soda is very good.This place is a gem! Great food, service, and very affordable. This was my first dining experience but it won't be my last. If you are in the area, give it a try!

54.description: Authentic...Fresh...HomemadeThis place is for real. It may not look like much from the outside, but the food is fantastic.

48.description: Was lookeing for something different and reasonably priced.   GF hit the spot.   We started with conch fitters and panadas.   The fritters were insanely moist and flavorful.  Two of us got jet chicken and the other stewed chicken.   We tried the potato salad, rice and beans and plantains.  Everything was fresh and delicious.    We were loving it so much we ordered desert, which we never do.... Sweet potato cake.    Tasted like it had just emerged from the oven...moist and tender.   Can't wait to go back

44.description: ahhhh...I Absolutly  love, love, love eating here! Their long Island ice tea is yummy and very pinapple-y. The jerk chicken is superb and their Guacamole with the Plantain chips are just to die for. It's a mom and pop place so I love supporting them. They do close early like 8pm so if you crave their food like I do... make plans to go early. They are also closed on Mondays so that's a bummer. The customer service is always great and they have a special drink (I don't know the name but if you ask about it I am sure they will know what i am talking about).When you drink it...it sooths your throat, clears your nostrils and warms up you tummy. It's magical. I swear by it. It is liquor so bring your ID. Overall Absolutly awesome comfort food. I definite recomend going at least once.

24.description: Excellent food, largish portions and friendly service.They have some nice beers and have parking alongside the restaurant.Had the Ox-tail stew, jerk chicken, beef stew with rice. The portions were enough for 2 or more meals.

7.description: First off let's address the location. Sure it's not like some neighborhoods in the city. It has diversity, culture, people outside of their homes. In no way does that translate to me feeling unsafe at.all. On a Friday night there were several families in the place and even if I was by myself would have felt right at home. The staff was very friendly and worked their tail off to bus, seat and serve all customers.We ordered the conch fritters and panades which were both amazing. I think I preferred the fritters but you can't go wrong with either. For our main dishes we had the jerk chicken and the king fish. The chicken was amazing, smoked and seasoned perfectly. The fish was solid, a bit over cooked, but the sauce was very good and cabbage and rice and beans that came with it were bomb.com/wow. If you are looking for a great atmosphere and food that is not your "usual" cuisine please give this place a try.

49.description: Looked it up on "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives." Gave it a shot, and it was AWESOME. My girlfriend and I were eager to have something different in the city of Chicago, and this was the it. The minute we walked in we were greeted nicely by, what seem to be the owner. We had a great server and the food was great. Indeed a hole in the wall, but truly enjoyed it all and highly recommend it!

40.description: The food at this place is soooooo delicious. The drinks were made so well and refreshing.  Our server was super attentive.  Not a fan of the neighborhood but that won't stop me from going there again.  The place is just too good to pass up.  You can't go wrong with the appetizers and the jerk chicken.  I loved the gravy that accompanies the red beans and rice as well.  Try it.  You won't be sorry.

53.description: Sigh... so close, and yet so far.......In Belizean:Me wan gih Garifuna Flava da 5 star, but ah can't yet.  Yah man, dey cook authentic, but da no de bes' belize food i evah git.  Eh good, doh!  Ah mi get di rice an' beans wih stew chicken, plantain, deh potato salad, deh panades, an' deh conx flittas.  Alla deh tings look good an' taste good, buh sumtin' jus' a lee bit off wih each plate fram wha' ah grow up wit.  Stew chicken mih good, buh ah guess ah' git tuh use tuh dah way ah mek it ah home.  Dat potato salad wih deh english creme good, man!   Dih panades wih deh hot peppah onions - yuh can't beat dat!  Even dah few fish bones noh botha' me none!  Conx flittas.... now dat dah mih mistake.  Ah grow up eatin' it fresh fram dih watah an' cook rite deh on dah key... so how Chicago gwen match dat when  eh gat no beach an' noh fresh conx.... Flava try hard, doh!  Ah mi drive ovah wan hour just fu do wan pickup.... su far weh... bu' yuh no find wan belizean restaurant in deh states often, so grab wen yuh can!.  In English:  I really want to give Garifuna Flava 5 stars, but I just can't yet.  Yes, they cook authentic, but it's not the best belizean food I've ever eaten.  It is good, though!  I ordered rice and beans with stewed chicken, fried plantains, belizean potato salad, panades, and conch fritters.All the dishes looked and tasted good, but there was something just a tiny bit off on each dish compared to what I grew up with.  The stew chicken was good, but I guess I'm too used to the way I make it at home.  The belizean potato salad with the english creme was good!  The panades with hot pepper onions... you can't beat that!  Even the few fish bones I encountered didn't bother me.  Conch fritters ... now that was my mistake.  I grew up eating them fresh from the sea and cooked right on the beach (cays).... so how could Chicago match that when there's no beach and no fresh conch.... ?  Garifuna Flava tries hard, though!I drove over an hour just to do a pick-up order... so far away.... but you don't find a Belizean restaurant in the US very often, so grab it while you can!

30.description: Garifuna Flava has pretty good food and I'm glad it is in the location that it is in. Growing up in Englewood, I was always disappointed in the lack of food options. How many times can one eat from the same Chinese restaurant, really? I still have family in the area, so today on a visit I decided to try out this restaurant.      There were two other people ordering with me and we placed a pretty large carry out order. We were told 20 minutes, and when we arrived it was all ready to go. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, conch soup, plantain chips and guacamole, and the Jamaican jerk and Belizean stew chicken lunch specials. I was so surprised when the total was less than 45 bucks!      Now onto the food: the panades had a good flavor, but I would have preferred a bit more filling. The plantain chips and guacamole were delicious and the portion size was great. The conch fritters were huge and were so delicious-definitely my favorite out of what we tried. They could have been a tad less greasy, though. The side conch soup was actually huge and full of veggies and seafood.      The lunch specials came with some side choices and we chose rice and beans, garden salad, potato salad, and stewed cabbage so we could try it all. The chicken in both lunch specials was flavorful and not dry. The jerk sauce was good too. Out of our sides, the cabbage was definitely the best. My husband enjoyed the potato salad, but he was literally given a tablespoon's worth. That was truly the only bummer out of our experience.      If you're in the area, definitely try this place out. I also read that there will be a buffet and drink specials for the upcoming Mayweather-Pacquiao fight so it might be a good time to dine in!

46.description: Found this place on yelp and dropped by a few hours before closing time on a Saturday night. Was greeted warmly by who I assume to be either the owner or the owner's son. Definitely a family owned and run restaurant. Despite the kitchen nightmare esque decor, the food was great. On second thought, the homely look was a perfect match for the  "home-cooked" style of the food. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, Jamaican jerk chicken (came with a side of rice and cabbage), oxtail stew, and an extra side of plantains. Both the panades and conch fritters were excellent, especially with the cabbage sauce it came with. All in all, the appetizers and sides seemed to shine more than the main dishes, but it was still all  very delicious. Will definitely come again! Don't forget the yelp check-in for 10% off!

1.description: Garifuna is fantastic. There are some dishes which are outstanding, and some which are 'merely' good.Outstanding list:5: that stew-oxtail. "Our meats are marinated with bell pepper, onions, vinegar, paprika & black pepper, then slow stewed and baked to perfection. Very tender and packed with flavor. All entrees are served with choice rice & beans, stew beans or split peas, fried ripe plantains and choice salad." KILLER. I can't phrase it better than them.Good list:4: Appetizer 331 platter. Those wings were killer, probably better than Nandos in seasoning and tenderness. I straight recommend getting just the wings over this, because the other 2 elements were just a-ok.4: Conch soup and Hudut Baruru I recommend as well.4: Red Snapper "This very popular white fish is delicate to the core. Served whole, it is deep fried & garnished in a sweet pepper, tomato, purple onion & garlic based creole sauce."Whoaw. Extremely fresh and well cooked, still lacking the extra oomph to reach oxtail level.2: Pigtail, it's an acquired taste. We were too full to try dessert, especially after the coconut-rice, stew beans, and fried plantains.WOW.

55.description: Garifuna Flava makes everything from scratch. If you enjoy caribbean-style cuisine, you will definitely enjoy the Traditional Belizean stewed chicken which is perfection in a bowl. It had a reddish color due to Recado (also known as "Achiote"), which is a commonly known spice in Belize. It is known for providing an amalgamation of slightly sweet and peppery flavors to stews, fish, chicken, beef, soups and sauces. It is the "Holy Grail" of spices in Belize. The food here is truly hearty, delectable, bright, bold and ethereal. I had the chicken stew ($5.95), and opted for the rice and beans which is a ubiquitous local dish in Belize. It was served with sweet plantains which were tender and excellent. My husband had the pot roast beef stew($6.95) which was incredibly flavorful and a gastronomical surprise! We both came to a mutual agreement (which doesn't happen very often in our marriage) that everything here is off-the-chart 5-star worthy. The only negative is that we didn't see anything on the their menu with coconut sauce, such as, Belizean Chicken in coconut sauce. This is NOT a Jamaican restaurant, so don't confuse it with Jamaican cuisine just because you see "Jerk Chicken" on the menu. When you eat a super hot chili pepper, you might sweat, burn the roof of your mouth, shed a few tears and your nose may even start running. To some people, this is a dining bliss experience. Not me. I don't want to be in pain when I eat. I don't want to cry when I eat. Think of comparing Jamaican jerk chicken and Belizean jerk chicken against a habanero pepper versus a jalapeno pepper. The habanero pepper has 40 times more heat than the jalapeno pepper.What we ordered was marinated with bell peppers, onions, vinegar, paprika and black pepper. The meats simmer for hours which makes them incredibly luscious, tender and succulent. We went here for lunch on Sunday, and started with the jerk chicken wings which had the right amount of kick. We also tried the conch fritters, with a crispy exterior and a tender melt-in-your mouth interior. These reminded me of cod fritters that my mom used to make for us when I was much younger. The conch fritters were ethereal and prodigious! We left here satisfied, electrified and our palates gratified.We never would have known about Garifuna Flava had it not been for them being at the Lakeview Taco Fest in 2014. They were serving up jerk chicken tacos worthy of more than 5-stars. Seriously! I recommend going here for lunch (they close at 8 pm on Sunday). The lunch portions were generous and very reasonable. My husband practically made love to his dessert: The caramel pound cake (also known as "Milk Cake") which he said was "really outstanding!" We are already planning a return visit, but next time, it will be dinner. The restaurant is bright, clean, welcoming and colorful. The employees were very hospitable, and we were made to feel like we were long-time customers. This is more than a 5-star worthy restaurant. Seriously.This restaurant was featured on "Check Please!" It was also featured on the "Food Network," "The Hungry Hound" and "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives."Price Point = 5 starsService: 5 starsLunch for two people (with water only) was under $30 and slightly over $25 (plenty of food for sharing too)

9.description: Based upon the reviews, I decided to drag my little cousin along for a cultural dish. Overall, I love the food. It was the first time I ever try Belize meal and they make for great leftovers. It's really not that different from Jamaican and Haitian meals.The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the cabbage and potatoes salad. Yet, I will come back.

26.description: Some of the best jerk chicken I have ever had. Love this place. Every time I go I get something different and I am thoroughly satisfied. Service is excellent and the place is clean. It's a diner so there isn't a lot of ambiance but the food and service make up for it if you are in to that sort of thing.

25.description: I am only giving 4 stars because although the food is AMAZING our waitress the last time we where there was inattentive, uninterested, and slow.

12.description: I am not use to this type of food but I definitely enjoyed the conch fritters. It was so good.  The service is like your at home having a meal with family. Not your family, a Belize family that can cook!

59.description: This place has character and delicious food.  Loved the conch fritter appetizer.  My $6 lunch special included 2 pieces Belizean stew chicken, rice and beans with a sauce you pour over it, sweet plantains, and stewed cabbage.  Every bite was delicious.  Tried a taste of the jerk chicken and potato salad side and both were great.  I would have paid 5 times what I did for these meals.  Great place to go with a group and perfect place to watch the World Cup.  A complete hole in the wall and I loved every detail.

21.description: First off let's address the location. Sure it's not like some neighborhoods in the city. It has diversity, culture, people outside of their homes. In no way does that translate to me feeling unsafe at.all. On a Friday night there were several families in the place and even if I was by myself would have felt right at home. The staff was very friendly and worked their tail off to bus, seat and serve all customers.We ordered the conch fritters and panades which were both amazing. I think I preferred the fritters but you can't go wrong with either. For our main dishes we had the jerk chicken and the king fish. The chicken was amazing, smoked and seasoned perfectly. The fish was solid, a bit over cooked, but the sauce was very good and cabbage and rice and beans that came with it were bomb.com/wow. If you are looking for a great atmosphere and food that is not your "usual" cuisine please give this place a try.

17.description: Ordered takeout here.  Pretty good Caribbean food.  However this wouldn't be my choice of foods to eat, however we wanted something different.  Anyways, I tried the sautéed shrimp, jerk chicken, plantains, beans and rice and some panades.  Shrimp were good, but, not that much included in a dinner order.   The jerk chicken was good. And you get a whole half chicken.   Panades were good as well.  Never had them, but I enjoyed.  The plantains were OK, but I'm not a fan of them overall.  Rice and beans were really good.  I liked how it was seasoned.  Definitely a good place to try and they've been featured on check please.  Plus they aren't too far from my house.   I might check them out again.

10.description: Soooooo I plan on going to the actual restaurant location very very soon. For those that work downtown definitely take advantage of Nosh Market at Block 37 (extended through March). I stumbled upon Garifuna and ordered the jerk chicken plate (jerk chicken, red rice and beans, and plantains) Every item was delicious. The jerk chicken was flavorful and whatever green sauce that was on the side was good! I like the red rice and beans had a spicy kick to them. The plantains were sweet and not overdone. I cannot wait to bring my mom to the actual location. That caramel pound cake is calling my name!

5.description: Great Caribbean food! The chicken was just right and the rice perfect. The drinks and the desserts go well with the meal. You have to try and be Irie as I was. Glad my coworker turned me onto this slice of paradise.

3.description: I have given this place chance after chance.  I've had bad encounters here before,  but I so desperately wanted to support this business, so I gave it another try.  They are nice people,  but  just not very professional!    I'm waving the white flag.  I've come 3 times and they were out of the item I wanted.   Once I dined in,  so not a big deal.  However, TWICE I called my order in, drove 35 minutes to pick it up, and when I walked through the door they tell me,  "I'm so sorry but we are out of XYZ and we didn't get a chance to call you back and tell you."   HOW INCONSIDERATE & UNPROFESSIONAL!?  They didn't try to compensate me for my inconvenience or anything! The owner and his son were just kinda nonchalant about it.   I even asked if what I wanted was available and they said YES!!!Don't bother coming here unless you are VERY flexible with your menu choices because they are always out of inventory,  and don't bother picking up your food unless you make SURE they have it in stock!  WELL, i thought I made sure and that still wasn't good enough! Again, I REALLLLY tried.   This was my 3rd really bad experience.   3 strikes,  you're out!

35.description: This restaurant is a hidden gem in the area I work in the area and I honestly wish we had more businesses like it, if I could give more than five stars I would

19.description: Ohhhhh this food is so good I came long distances to eat it again lol. The jerk chicken gives Jamaica competition, their stew chicken gives my moms Trinidad stew chicken good rivalry, the rice and beans r never dry, so moist and tasty, speaking of tasty, the sauces!!! Anything dat has a sauce is sooo good and compliments the food sublimely. The panades are so tiny n tasty it's a blissful surprise and the lil accompaniment with it was perfect. They have parking which is good, the place is clean cool n fresh, rastaman is usually dere n he is very nice, good service! Even if u r a foodie or not u jus need this food in ur life

28.description: They came to my job today, and after reading such great reviews, i was eager to try it. I had the following:Stew Chicken: I really loved the stew chicken. Extremely flavorful and the meat would fall right off of the bone. Will definitely be my 'go to' dish when i visit their actual restaurant. I've never liked stew chicken from other restaurants i've tried, but they hit it right on the nail with how they prepare it.Jerk Chicken: It wasn't bad, but i've had better in Chicago. As mentioned in a previous review, the jerk chicken isn't spicy at all and almost tasted like normal bbq chicken...but what made me like it, is when i dipped the chicken in the side of green sauce they give you. Once i did that, then the jerk chicken had a chance. Rice and Beans: Extremely good, great texture, and especially loved the gravy that they pour on top of it. Was the best rice and beans i've ever had. Would definitely order this again.  Cabbage: The cabbage was good, it had a hint of spiciness to it which i loved about it. No complaints here and would order this side again.Overall the food was great. I almost feel like i was charged a premium for the fact they were bringing the food to my company vs. me picking the food up at their actual restaurant. Paid $25 for all of the food above, and each were in very small containers. Hope when i visit the restaurant the portions are a bit bigger for the cost, but overall good! It was great to see a restaurant thats located on the south side of chicago, come downtown to participate in the FOODA program. Keep up the hard work!

45.description: Ordered takeout here.  Pretty good Caribbean food.  However this wouldn't be my choice of foods to eat, however we wanted something different.  Anyways, I tried the sautéed shrimp, jerk chicken, plantains, beans and rice and some panades.  Shrimp were good, but, not that much included in a dinner order.   The jerk chicken was good. And you get a whole half chicken.   Panades were good as well.  Never had them, but I enjoyed.  The plantains were OK, but I'm not a fan of them overall.  Rice and beans were really good.  I liked how it was seasoned.  Definitely a good place to try and they've been featured on check please.  Plus they aren't too far from my house.   I might check them out again.

33.description: Delicious food and a wonderful waiter! The chicken stew was flavorful. I enjoyed the rice and plantains on the side. It complemented the chicken. Both desserts were yummy...sweet potato cake and butter cake with dulce de leche...served warm.

43.description: I went with my regular brunch crew and I must say we were not disappointed.We saw the place on DDV and got to meet the owner. Really cool guy.We basically ordered every appetizer and they were all delicious. My favorite was the chicken tamale. It took a little long to get everything, but we could tell it was all made with love by the owner's mom! (Yes his mom is the chef!!!!)

2.description: Really solid food at a great price range. I really enjoyed the stewed oxtail and the red snapper was magnificent (a little pricey at $18... though). Also, their jerk chicken was phenomenal - very tender. The rice with mashed peas was really tasty. The service was lovely too... It's quite a hidden gem :). Check in on Yelp for a 10% discount!

18.description: Found this place on yelp and dropped by a few hours before closing time on a Saturday night. Was greeted warmly by who I assume to be either the owner or the owner's son. Definitely a family owned and run restaurant. Despite the kitchen nightmare esque decor, the food was great. On second thought, the homely look was a perfect match for the  "home-cooked" style of the food. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, Jamaican jerk chicken (came with a side of rice and cabbage), oxtail stew, and an extra side of plantains. Both the panades and conch fritters were excellent, especially with the cabbage sauce it came with. All in all, the appetizers and sides seemed to shine more than the main dishes, but it was still all  very delicious. Will definitely come again! Don't forget the yelp check-in for 10% off!

41.description: I went here for dinner with a coworker/friend and the food was absolutely amazing. The business is family-run, and I was treated like I was part of a big family. I brought home leftovers and they didn't make it to the next day. Absolutely fantastic.

52.description: Staff had a little attitude. Besides that the food was good. I would go again.

50.description: A place that actually sums up what it is in its name, Garifuna Flava. This place has plenty of Flava! I dined in yesterday at Garifuna Flava. Upon getting there I was a little iffy because of the location and neighborhood its in, but despite the gloomy area, the restaurant is decently decorated & comfortable. I started off my dinner by ordering the Belizean long island which was recommended by my server (nice choice) and started with the 3-3-1 appetizer platter.  The 3-3-1 appetizer platter consisted of 3 jerk wings, 3 panes, and 1 garnache. Jerk wings were good, panes were excellent, and the garnache was delish! Panes are very similar to the latin empanadas, but belizean version. They were filled with fish mix and was perfectly crisp outside and cooked perfectly inside. Went well with the sauce too.  The garnache was my favorite, very similar to the mexican tostadas with beans, cheese, sour cream and etc. The garnache was a bit different, it included tostada, cabbage mix, cheeses, and ketchup sauce. I normally HATE eating ketchup on my food but this was the perfect exception. My main dish was the stew chicken, which was great!  It was packed with flavor and was served in stew sauce rather than in a stew.  It was medium spicey, kind of peppery, and the chicken was tender and falling of the bones. My overall experience was awesome, server was nice and insightful (young black women with dreads),  good was perfectly cooked and seasoned, and the restaurant was cozy for a cold night. Definitely going back, it is a MUST try people!

4.description: Hussein is the man. Thank you for all your hard work and dedication to Garifuna Flava. Place is amazing.  Stew chicken is amazing and the ducunu is spot on. Service is always amazing.

6.description: Belize might be my favorite place on earth, and Garifuna Flava is a little piece of paradise on the South Side. If you miss conch fritters, red snapper stew, hudut, and darasa, you cannot go wrong. It's just like being in a Garinagu town like Hopkins or Seine Bight. And the bitters! 151 rum with all the roots and herbs that legend says will bring a man to attention. Go with a big group so you can taste everything.

22.description: Where to try everything all the dishes are great. The stew chicken, beef, the oxtails are my fav! The jerk chicken, is a must. Lastly, the tamales, theses are not your average tamales. Whole pieces of chicken, veggies, juicy flavors pouring out of every bit! Two things you have to order the 1/2 jerk chicken, it's a lot of food, tamales are on strike until October. Go during lunch with a friend and split the food. You should be able to try everything and still have a tad bit of change left!

15.description: These wonderful folks catered our work lunch today and it was a scrum amongst us all for seconds and thirds. MAN was it delicious! Stew & jerk chicken were fall-off-the-bone good, plantains were perfect, and rice and beans excellent. Really wonderful stuff.

57.description: Honest review do not go here i went because it was in diners drive in an dives the food was not good i was so disappointed like its nothing special i would not go there ever again it is honestly not good

20.description: So I am following Guy Fieri And his adventures through town. We stopped here and initially were Concerned. I would not on my own accord  stop here if it weren't suggested by the Man. Met with the owner and felt a little more at ease. Once the food started coming out, You would not believe that the food coming out of this place was this good.

36.description: Very delicious, despite the Caribbean jerk chicken being smaller in proportions than I'm use to I have no qualms with either the flavor or the service. I can honestly say I do not remember the last time I dined out and had as genuinely nice servers. Both had an air of happiness and friendliness i felt was contagious and that added to the experience.The sides were a fried plantain: perfectBeans and rice: good but a little dryGravy for beans and rice: perfect and negated any dryness resulting in singing taste buds.I'd also recommend trying a Caribbean soda, I got pineapple ginger and wow. I have never had that combination and truly have been missing out.Great food, service, and its something out of the ordinary.

14.description: Great flavors on the brown stew chicken and the conch fritters were flavorful but over fried which had a lil burn taste to them...will try again!

1.description: Dry and tasteless ground beef and chicken tacos. This is a walk-up/drive thru spot.

0.description: It is a walk up and drive thru spot, but the food I usually order is great. The salsa with the chips has great unique flavor.  They deep fry their own chips too!  I usually get a steak torta on a regular basis.I did try the cheese and meat fries.  Excellent!  Not real good for you, but tasty!Only reason I put 4 instead of 5 stars is because it's only a drive-through place. Otherwise I love this place.

58.description: Such a lovely addition to the neighborhood! Now that I live in North Hyde Park, I no longer have as many opportunities to stop by, but whenever I do, I am not disappointed! The café is always buzzing with a refreshing mix of high schoolers from the neighborhood and U of C students. Their iced chai cannot be beat -- I have tried to get a peek at their brand of concentrate and have never been able to figure out which kind they use, but it's absolutely to die for. I also recommend their offerings from the Brown Sugar Bakery - yum!

56.description: Some of the best coffee in the area. I love the atmosphere, there are many tables and outlets, so it is a good place to work or study. They also have terrific smoothies.

29.description: The service here sucks! I've popped in a few times and almost always made to feel like an inconvenience. Don't expect a "hello", "good morning ", a smile or even eye contact, it more than likely won't happen here. This morning I needed coffee and stopped by...I noticed flies in the donut/danish glass area...I left. The one star is for the pleasant afternoon staff...

42.description: This is my sister and I go to spot for tea/ coffee and catching up. We usually walk over since I live 3 blocks away. Great coffee drinks, yesterday I had a regular grilled cheese and tomato sandwich which was good. The service is good although I've heard of others having a bad experience here. I think its a great neighborhood joint that deserves the good reviews it has earned.

23.description: Nice small place to get some coffee and baked goods. Their sandwiches aren't bad either! Definitely worth a try.

47.description: For someone who studies so close, it's a shame that I hadn't visited Robust more often. This cafe is thankfully relatively not crowded and mostly devoid of students so it's a lovely escape from academia. It's a relatively small place but that adds to it's charm. Numerous tables near outlets and free wifi make this an excellent place to do work beyond the confines of a library. It's a lot quieter than a Starbucks, even with music playing, Their coffee is excellent and decently priced. But lemme tell you about their Rueben: A+. Just the right amount of corned need and cabbage. So delicious. I'm actually sad that I have been living so long without it. If you're in the area, come on by. You won't regret it.

8.description: I meet the owners when they were building this cafe. I knew then it would bring new life into a neighborhood with very few social spots to hand out. Robust is a great place to meet with friends and family or to do a quick meeting. They since than have opened a new lounge on 416 W Ontario St. They both are the perfect mix of great coffee, social atmosphere and goooood food. :)

31.description: Great service great drinks and food I just wish they ordered more inventory and kept their stock up they are always out of my two favorite drinks cake batter and vanilla bean mix

34.description: I didn't really like my experience here. That being said, I won't give Robust a low rating because I recognize there wasn't much the staff could have done to make it better. I was here in the afternoon, about 3PM, and the café was absolutely overrun with loud, rowdy schoolchildren. The staff tried to quiet them down, but to no avail. I held out hope that maybe there was a special back room into which the children would be ushered and locked into, but no dice. The kids stopped coming in at around 5, although the noise level remained somewhat loud, as many people seem to use this café as a meeting/tutoring space. If not for the kids, this would be a cool place. I had the honey nut latte, which is made with almond milk, and is really tasty. I like that there's a variety of seating and a selection of books/magazines. The service was kind of surly, but I probably wouldn't be too friendly either if I had to deal with those kids for 2 hours. They have a huge sandwich list, but the prices were high. I would not make a special trip to Robust, but if you're in the area, it makes a nice hang-out spot. Just make sure to avoid between 3-5PM on weekdays.

16.description: Nice place! Had the BBQ Betty. It was suppose to be on a pretzel bun, they were out of them so I was offered an onion roll. I must say it was tasty but every bite I wished I had that pretzel bun.  Also Got a piece of Carmel cake that was huge, tasted average and was $5, ugh. Seems like a great place to escape and get some work done, or  study. Nothing else really around it in walking distance.

13.description: A very solid neighborhood coffee shop with friendly staff and tasty food. Good prices all the way around. I'm definitely sad that I don't live around the corner from them anymore. My only issue is that they are fairly slow with getting food out, which isn't great if you're on your way to work. They also don't use the highest quality ingredients in their breakfast items--very processed mixes, etc. But their sandwiches are great and reasonably priced.

11.description: Looks like it could be a nice place but I wasn't pleased with the service....or lack thereof. We walked in to get drinks and ice cream and when I saw the menu I told my kids maybe we'd come in one day for breakfast. We stood at the counter and there was a girl making a drink. Her hair was awesome but she glanced at us and said nothing. We stood around.  A guy came from the back and made eye contact, but said nothing. We stood around. The girl came over and stood there silently. No, "hello, may I help you?" Nothing. My son wants to know if they have ice cream. "Floats." He asks again. I try to explain that from her response I assume they only have vanilla ice cream and some sort of flavors of soda. She remains silent. He asks if they have cookies and cream. She shakes her head. Ok, he'll take a cookie. I ask what the shaken lemonade is. It's lemonade with flavors. Ok. We order a lemonade.  I ask how much the boxed water is (because it's fancy and people like to charge ridiculous prices for fancy stuff) She doesn't answer. Ok. "So you want a cookie, a lemonade and a boxed water?" No, I wanted to know how much the water is. $2. No thanks. She fresh squeezed (awesome!) the lemonade for my daughter and hands it to me. We walk out and my daughter spits the lemonade out. It's bitter. Unsweetened. Why not mention that? We go back in for sugar.  Maybe I asked too many questions. Maybe I wanted more because I'd just run 3 miles or maybe it was because I kept seeing this place and saying I was going to stop in. Whatever it was, I wasn't pleased with the service.  I've had a bad week dealing with UPS and Comcast, I want a smile and a hello at the local coffee shop, I guess.

39.description: I am a Youth Readiness Mentor, and in mid-July, my mentees and I decided to meet at Robust for our regular weekly meeting. After purchasing a drink from the counter and waiting for my mentees to arrive, I realized that the employees were stealing disapproving glances at our table far too frequently. They peeked around the corner and walked away whispering among themselves and made me so uncomfortable that I gathered my mentees and left. I can't, after all, successfully teach job readiness in a place where disapproval and discriminatory behavior is so blatant. I don't know if the problem was that we went on a Sunday, or if it was that the young men in my group had on jeans. At any rate, there is wi-fi and coffee all over the city. This is one place we SHAN'T visit again.

37.description: Absolutely the best of everything; atmosphere, customer service, food and last but not least, coffee... which just happens to be superbly 'Robust'.

0.description: Robust Coffee is my favorite Hyde Park-area coffee shop. In order: 4. Sip & Savor3. Bridgeport Coffee2. Greenline (Woodlawn location)1. Robust CoffeeTheir Honey Nut Latte is delicious and I absolutely love the homemade biscuits and gravy, too.

38.description: I used to really love going to this place...my last three visits they gave me the wrong order after waiting for 15 minutes and then I had to wait another 15 minutes to get my order right. Needless to say, my hot chocolate or should I say hot milk got cold. I used to love their hot chocolate, but now they add a drop of chocolate sauce for any size and all I have is a cup of milk. I have to go out of my way to get to this place and I am disappointed. The plain bagels with cream cheese are still good, but this will be my last time going there...

51.description: Literally my absolute favorite place to go get work done. I work from home most of the year and love coming here to get out of the house. They have killer service, great coffee, really good sandwiches. They don't make their own pastries, but they're good (nothing to write home about). They also always have a good set of music playing. My hubby is a med student at UChicago and it's convenient but out of the way enough that it's not crowded. Free internet is a huge plus too!!

27.description: WORST COFFEE SHOP EVER, I wish I could give them negative stars..there was only one person ahead of me and We both had to wait ten minutes for someone to acknowledge us...I then had to wait another ten minutes in line once my order was taken.  After  waiting patiently for ten min. I  asked to speak to the manager for a refund for the long wait and he told me that I was impatient and needed to wait and would not give me a refund. I believe his name was jake or Jeff , white guy (slim) brown hair with glasses...he then proceeded to make other drinks for  for people who ordered after me. Then he asked me what did I order . Also, there was no where to sit because the place is crowded with teenagers  who don't buy anything.bottom line is go to Starbucks and not patronize this neighborhood business...this place deserves no stars and the employees at Starbucks acknowledge their customers!!!!!!

32.description: Robust is my goto spot when I want a change of scenery from my home office. There's always something good to eat (and good for me) but then there's also those pastries they bring in from Brown Sugar Bakery that always tempt me to indulge. The space is well designed and there's plenty of room to socialize or get stuff done. The staff is fast and friendly. The location is perfect. It's a community hub so there's always a circle of folks chatting about big ideas and having meetings there, so it's not a bad place to network either. I highly recommend Robust!

54.description: Best coffee shop on the Southside. No context. This is one of my favorite places in Chicago

48.description: As an avid patron of this coffee shop since its opening. I was greeted by a horrible experience today. I had a conference call to conduct. I was late for the call and decided to sit down and make the call, I had every intention to purchase something once the call was completed. During the call, I was repeatedly harassed several times by a staff member and once by the owner of the establishment to buy something or leave! Now while I might have worn what you may consider "urban apparel" and not a tuxedo this is no way to treat a returning/potential customer! I felt embarrassed during the call with a new hire candidate to halt the call to reassure staff I was going to purchase an item. After the call I proceeded to the register to purchase a coffee and juice and wanted to voice my disappointing opinion to the owner. I was told he "left" no more than 10 minutes after confronting me. Whether he was there hiding or really did leave I left my business card and told the staff member who confronted me initially this is not a way to run a business. She began to dribble generalizations and decided to tell me that I was part of a problem that begun after I walked in and another customer sat in their establishment without purchasing. I was floored! On top of the harassment, I'm now part of a conspiracy with a stranger I've never met to waste your resources? She then said: "Birds of a feather, flock together!" My brain could not believe what I was hearing. I would say the staff member did thank me for some reason but I felt it was a contrived effort to deescalate the situation before it became worst. In conclusion, as a fellow business-owner I empathize with the daily struggles it takes to run a business and when you encounter a potential customer who may appear to be taking advantage of your gratitude it may feel like a slap in the face. I get it. However, I live one block away, have frequented the business numerous times and was treated like total trash today. I wasn't a bum looking to rudely hassle the other customers for money. I was clearly a busy customer who thought a neighborhood coffee shop such as Robust would be a "friendly" place to support and work at for an hour. Clearly Robust has become a product of an environment I thought was long forgotten in the Woodlawn Community even with the surrounding crime/violence. It has in its time active here in our neighborhood turned into a rude place that I will NEVER recommend to be visited to my friends and family for the foreseeable future. I will be mentioning this to my Alderman as well being I live across the street from him. We should not condone this sort of treatment in our community.BE WARNED: "No Trust in Robust!" (Unless you buy something.)

44.description: They aight. Fecking expensive though; they take their geographic monopoly deadly serious. The menu is on the wall, and what's there is it; this place is not terribly veg-friendly. It's a decent place to sit, sip and snack, and there's a take one/leave one library there as well. Robust is nothing to crow about, but it will serve if you're in this no-mans land of food options and need something to satisfy.

24.description: Awesome neighborhood coffee shop. I live down the street so I visit frequently. The staff is friendly, drinks are good, chill atmosphere, and the sandwiches and pastries are pretty tasty.

7.description: This place beats the pants out of Starbucks.  Staff is very friendly and the decor is old school with industrial qualities. I would definitely suggest having a taste of the honey nut latte. This drink is an amazing warm, smooth, and just the right amount of love in a cup  to brighten any day.

49.description: Quite a nice place - the atmosphere is humming but not noisy, which is the kind of ambiance I like when I'm doing work.I tried the BBQ Lou and the Herbie. The former was a winner - brisket was delicious and the coleslaw and bun were the perfect accompaniment. Bonus: they give you little Tootsie Rolls/Pops with your meal!The Herbie, on the other hand, wasn't my favorite - the sandwich was basically a HUGE scoop of (really bland) chicken salad with some lettuce and bacon. The pumpernickel bread it came on was pretty good, but I wouldn't recommend the sandwich as a whole.I also had a chai latte, which was nice if a little on the bland side as well. While the flavor of the chai was good, it felt like the chai to milk ratio was a little low. I still enjoyed it enough that I would order it again, though.Boyfriend had two of the smoothies: the Hawaiian Dream and the Sunrise. I snuck a little of each - the former was my favorite of the two.Overall, definitely worth the trip, and a nice place to get some studying done.

40.description: Original Review was 2 StarsWhen we first started to come here, this place was pretty cool. It is a quick walk from our apartment and nice to go to. The coffee and coffee based drinks are pretty good. However, the problem comes with the food. First off, it is kind of expensive for what you get. Secondly, they take a horribly long time to do fairly simple tasks. Thirdly, they tend to lose the food tickets a lot. When that happens, they aren't very apologetic and kind of look at you like you're trying to scam them (although they gave you a number for your food and it is still sitting on your table). Most of the staff has changed since we first started coming here and I feel like the service went down when that happened. I would like to still come here since it is close to home and I'd hate for the business to leave since it is one of the few places like this. However, just because it doesn't have any competition doesn't mean that their customer service should suck.10/3/15In the past year or so, Robust has really changed and become a lot better.  It still takes awhile to get food sometimes, but the staff actually being pleasant makes the whole place seem a lot better.

53.description: One of those really happy surprises... when you end up in a neighborhood you've never been in before at 8:30am on a Saturday morning with just enough time for coffee, and yelp informs you that there's a non-Starbucks coffee shop nearby.  The only thing I was really bummed about was that I had to grab and go; the space inside was great and I could definitely see myself sitting in there for an hour or a few at a time.  I had an iced latte which was totally solid, and this ridiculous donut which kept me powered up all through my morning.  Three cheers for independent coffee shops kicking ass!  Especially at 63rd and woodlawn!

30.description: I really like this place, but we tried to get seated today about 4pm and it was impossible. The line to order was all the way to the door. We got back in the car and went to Greenline.

46.description: Let's see..I loved the little atmosphere it had, not bland at all. Smelled like coffee and eggs! I loved that part.I decided to make my own sandwich. I made a croissant sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich. The sad part that made this place lose points was that the bread was very dry.The coffee? Now that was good. Good strong roast with some caramel I added.

1.description: The Good:- the people behind the counter are fantastic and friendly. Love them all!- great brand of coffee. - cool atmosphere- good location- comfortable- non-dairy milks available- nice selection of baked goods from a local bakery- coffee by-the-pound that they will grind for you- nice selection of smoothies- homemade "diablo" syrup is a sweet and spicy coffee flavour they make in house for the Mocha Diablo. - usually quiet,  FREE WIFI! Great to get some work done.- Kid friendly, with a book shelf for reading in your down timeThe Bad:- non-dairy milks are all sweetened, which makes any fancy non-dairy latte TOO sweet after the flavouring is added.- a lot of the food is low quality pre-made mixes and packaged products (pancakes aren't fresh made batter, hummus is pre-packaged, the "cheese" is orange american style single slices,  breakfast condiments are just Smucker's jams and pancake syrupetc. Skip the food.)- blended cold drinks are made with a packet of pre-mixed artificially flavoured powders (YUCK. Just skip these entirely)- flavoured coffee syrups are cheap, teeth shatteringly sweet and give your latte a chemical taste. Avoid the flavored coffees (with the exception of the homemade Diablo syrup).I want to love Robust, but I can't give 5 stars because they are lacking in quality and attention to detail. I'll keep going back though, because small local business support is important, and they're still miles better than DD or Starbucks!

55.description: I live on the Northside, when I started working in the Woodlawn/Englewood area I needed a getaway from the office and a place to catch a breath.  Just coming across the building I tried a sandwich and coffee back in the summer, been going ever since.  Price is right, their selection is pretty wide, having  lots of choices for sandwiches and brunch/lunch options.  Oh and the coffee is on POINT.

9.description: Hands down one of the best coffee shops in the city, right up there with Dollop. The coffee is great, the food smells delicious, though I've yet to taste any of the cuisine. The atmosphere is very trendy, but manages to still feel very south side. There are plenty of outlets and seats, although the few times I went, the available seating was limited to the area by the door, because the lounge area was pretty packed.  When I was growing up down the street, I would never have imagined a place this cool and diverse venturing outside of the Hyde Park/ U of C area, but I'm glad they did.

26.description: I've been an avid fan of Robust for years now. The drinks are cheap (or at least cheaper than Starbucks) and I've never had a problem with my order. The sandwiches are great - my go to's are the sausage biscuit and the BBQ Betty. They run a variety of promotions ($5 sandwiches after a certain time, half price coffee at certain times) so check their fb page before you drop by.

25.description: Solid place, competes with all of the great coffee shops on the North Side without the inconvenience of parking/crowds AND without the price tag. You can get a sandwich and a coffee for about $5 here.

12.description: Great place for studying. Lots of room and everyone is super nice. Their mocha is amazing. Plus, the breakfast sandwich I ordered was made fresh. It was so good! My friend didn't love the mocha because she said it was too sweet, but I think a little sweetness it deserved with chocolate. She did love the apple donut though! I can't wait to return!

59.description: What a gem. I've been coming here on and off for about three years; it's a disservice to not have written a review until now. The downside for me is location - I live on the north side. That's probably a good thing, because I'd be there every day if I could.The coffee is really good, though not the best I've ever had. Robust stands out for a few reasons; their fantastic chai tea latte, great food, and consistently great service. My favorites among their many food items are the turkey and cranberry sandwich on a croissant and their cookies.Even if you don't live in the area, find a way to go check this place out. I used to do some work at the health clinic nearby, which was my original gateway to it. If you're a U of C student, do yourself a favor and make this your study spot.

21.description: I've been to Robust in Woodlawn a few times when visiting my sister at University of Chicago. While the food can be a bit inconsistent at times, overall I've left really satisfied. Coffee is fantastic. Vibes are egalitarian and academic. I'd say this is one of the few places in and around U Chicago that local residents and students genuinely interact. Staff has always been very friendly and accommodating.

17.description: For someone who studies so close, it's a shame that I hadn't visited Robust more often. This cafe is thankfully relatively not crowded and mostly devoid of students so it's a lovely escape from academia. It's a relatively small place but that adds to it's charm. Numerous tables near outlets and free wifi make this an excellent place to do work beyond the confines of a library. It's a lot quieter than a Starbucks, even with music playing, Their coffee is excellent and decently priced. But lemme tell you about their Rueben: A+. Just the right amount of corned need and cabbage. So delicious. I'm actually sad that I have been living so long without it. If you're in the area, come on by. You won't regret it.

10.description: Nice little coffee spot but I wasn't a fan of the London Fog. Honestly just tasted like warm milk and tea... Their sandwiches look really great though.

5.description: Despite having lived within walking distance to Robust for the past year, I never made the short trek there to try it out before now. What a mistake! This spot has delicious food, plenty of seating, and fantastic music playing to liven up the atmosphere. This is a very sunny spot that is perfect for grabbing lunch with a friend or for studying. They have a great selection of sandwiches for lunch- I had the roast beef, which came on an onion roll and was very tasty! I can't wait to come back here again and try out the many yummy-looking pastries and cakes they have on display!

3.description: I have always been wondering if there was any good coffee shop around the University of Chicago.  Back in January this year, my Yelp Elite friends, Eva. S and Jen B. (Hi, girls) showed me this Indie coffee shop passport.  Robust Coffee Lounge in Woodlawn was on the list.  I finally made it here with Daddy J.  RCL technically isn't "on" campus, but it's south of UC border on the southwest corner of Woodlawn and 63rd.  Their coffee is reasonably-priced.  For $8 and some change, we had a large, bold, and wake-me-up Americano and a large, mildly-spiced, calm-me-down Diablo mocha.  I actually like this place a lot for these following reasons:1) free working wifi2) bright lighting through large windows3) plenty of seating for solo and group travelers4) friendly service 5) good selections of books, magazines, and newspapers They accept major credit cards (not sure about the minimum purchase).  It's also accessible via #63 bus (with a seasonal service east to the 63rd. St. Beach).Ok, now I'm done with the review.  It's time for me to space out at RCL...

35.description: I come here a LOT because of its proximity to my workplace--sometimes on the clock and sometimes not, depending. In the 25 or so times that I've been to Robust, I've tried a LOT of the menu and I have also had a lot of different interactions with different staff. I have not had a particularly consistent experience here, which is why I have held off on a review. I've had some five-star customer service experiences and some two-star customer dr vide experiences. I've had some five-star food and some two-star food. I'm going to focus instead on my overall experience, including the sum of 25 visits to Robust. Overall, Robust is an excellent addition to the Woodlawn community. It's located conveniently right on the corner and it's a meeting place for lifelong residents of the community, as well as University of Chicago staff and students who want to venture a little off the beaten path off campus. Uniform-clad school children can frequently be found here enjoying a snack or beverage after school hours. The diversity of customers at Robust is great and adds to the welcoming atmosphere.The service can be hit or miss. Some of the staff are incredibly kind, patient, and friendly, while others are fairly negligent and inattenive. My orders are messed up maybe 35% of the time, which is not the best. I have had my order forgotten more than a few times. Sometimes, the staff are really apologetic and offer to give me extra flavor or a bigger size to compensate. Sometimes, they barely bat an eyelash. I've tried maybe half of the menu items, including blended drinks like the oreo madness, smoothies like the almond milk, banana, chai, food items like the grilled cheese and hummus platter, the mocha diablo, pumpkin spice latte, gingerbread latte, etc. So, why the four-star rating? At the end of the day, I know I can count on Robust to be a cozy haven--a true gem in Woodlawn. Robust has a great atmosphere, acceptable drinks/food/prices, and (most importantly, for me) seating, outlets, and wifi. Seriously, I have never not been able to find a seat or outlet here and that is the most important thing! I will continue to be a happy customer at Robust as long as I work in Woodlawn.

19.description: I've been an avid fan of Robust for years now. The drinks are cheap (or at least cheaper than Starbucks) and I've never had a problem with my order. The sandwiches are great - my go to's are the sausage biscuit and the BBQ Betty. They run a variety of promotions ($5 sandwiches after a certain time, half price coffee at certain times) so check their fb page before you drop by.

28.description: Quirky, independent local establishment that is great for coming with friends for unique breakfast combinations. Whenever I'm in Chicago my friends and I come here after Mass. Try the bacon waffles!

45.description: I loved the ambiance! They have books! They have Yummy hot fresh fast breakfast sandwiches. I had an egg and cheese on a biscuit and a ginger peach tea. Yum. I didn't want to leave. The staff is nice too.
